Suppose fğ‘“f is Î´ğ›¿\delta-weakly convex. Then, for any Î³â‰¥Î´ğ›¾ğ›¿\gamma\geq\delta, and a sequence of parameters {ğ²i}iâˆˆğ’®subscriptsubscriptğ²ğ‘–ğ‘–ğ’®\{\bm{y}_{i}\}_{i\in\mathcal{S}} and ğ±ğ±\bm{x}:

1|ğ’®|â€‹âˆ‘iâˆˆğ’®fâ€‹(ğ’ši)+Î³2â€‹âˆ¥ğ’™âˆ’ğ’šiâˆ¥2â‰¥fâ€‹(ğ’šÂ¯)+Î³2â€‹âˆ¥ğ’™âˆ’ğ’šÂ¯âˆ¥2,Â whereÂ â€‹ğ’šÂ¯:=1|ğ’®|â€‹âˆ‘iâˆˆğ’®ğ’ši.formulae-sequence1ğ’®subscriptğ‘–ğ’®ğ‘“subscriptğ’šğ‘–ğ›¾2superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥ğ’™subscriptğ’šğ‘–2ğ‘“Â¯ğ’šğ›¾2superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥ğ’™Â¯ğ’š2assignÂ whereÂ Â¯ğ’š1ğ’®subscriptğ‘–ğ’®subscriptğ’šğ‘–\frac{1}{\lvert\mathcal{S}\rvert}\sum_{i\in\mathcal{S}}f(\bm{y}_{i})+\frac{\gamma}{2}\lVert\bm{x}-\bm{y}_{i}\rVert^{2}\geq f(\bar{\bm{y}})+\frac{\gamma}{2}\lVert\bm{x}-\bar{\bm{y}}\rVert^{2}\,,\text{ where }\bar{\bm{y}}:=\frac{1}{\lvert\mathcal{S}\rvert}\sum_{i\in\mathcal{S}}\bm{y}_{i}\,.
Proof.

Since fğ‘“f is Î´ğ›¿\delta-weakly convex, Î¦â€‹(ğ’›):=fâ€‹(ğ’›)+Î³2â€‹âˆ¥ğ’›âˆ’ğ’™âˆ¥2assignÎ¦ğ’›ğ‘“ğ’›ğ›¾2superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥ğ’›ğ’™2\Phi(\bm{z}):=f(\bm{z})+\frac{\gamma}{2}\lVert\bm{z}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2} is convex. This proves the claim since 1|ğ’®|â€‹âˆ‘iâˆˆğ’®Î¦â€‹(ğ’ši)â‰¤Î¦â€‹(ğ’šÂ¯)1ğ’®subscriptğ‘–ğ’®Î¦subscriptğ’šğ‘–Î¦Â¯ğ’š\frac{1}{\lvert\mathcal{S}\rvert}\sum_{i\in\mathcal{S}}\Phi(\bm{y}_{i})\leq\Phi(\bar{\bm{y}}). âˆ

Appendix F Convergence with a generic base optimizer

Let us rewrite the Mime and MimeLite updates using notation convenient for analysis. In each round tğ‘¡t, we sample clients ğ’®tsuperscriptğ’®ğ‘¡\mathcal{S}^{t} such that |ğ’®t|=Ssuperscriptğ’®ğ‘¡ğ‘†\lvert\mathcal{S}^{t}\rvert=S. The server communicates the server parameters ğ’™tâˆ’1superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡1\bm{x}^{t-1} as well as the average gradient across the sampled clients ğ’„tsuperscriptğ’„ğ‘¡\bm{c}^{t} defined as

ğ’„t=1Sâ€‹âˆ‘iâˆˆğ’®tâˆ‡fiâ€‹(ğ’™tâˆ’1).superscriptğ’„ğ‘¡1ğ‘†subscriptğ‘–superscriptğ’®ğ‘¡âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡1\bm{c}^{t}=\frac{1}{S}\sum_{i\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x}^{t-1})\,. (11)

Note that computing ğ’„tsuperscriptğ’„ğ‘¡\bm{c}^{t} (required only by Mime but not by MimeLite) itself requires additional communication. In this proof, we do not make any assumption on how ğ’„tsuperscriptğ’„ğ‘¡\bm{c}^{t} is computed as long as it is unbiased and is computed over Sğ‘†S clients. In particular, it can either be computed on the sampled ğ’®tsuperscriptğ’®ğ‘¡\mathcal{S}^{t} or a different set of an independent sampled clients ğ’®~tsuperscript~ğ’®ğ‘¡\tilde{\mathcal{S}}^{t}.

Then each client iâˆˆğ’®tğ‘–superscriptğ’®ğ‘¡i\in\mathcal{S}^{t} makes a copy ğ’ši,0t=ğ’™tâˆ’1superscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘–0ğ‘¡superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡1\bm{y}_{i,0}^{t}=\bm{x}^{t-1} and perform Kğ¾K local client updates. In each local client update kâˆˆ[K]ğ‘˜delimited-[]ğ¾k\in[K], the client samples a dataset Î¶i,ktsuperscriptsubscriptğœğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡\zeta_{i,k}^{t} and

ğ’ši,ktsuperscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡\displaystyle\bm{y}_{i,k}^{t} =ğ’ši,kâˆ’1tâˆ’Î·â€‹ğ’°â€‹(âˆ‡fiâ€‹(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t;Î¶i,kt)âˆ’âˆ‡fiâ€‹(ğ’™tâˆ’1;Î¶i,kt)+ğ’„t;ğ’”tâˆ’1)absentsuperscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘–ğ‘˜1ğ‘¡ğœ‚ğ’°âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘–ğ‘˜1ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğœğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡1superscriptsubscriptğœğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡superscriptğ’„ğ‘¡superscriptğ’”ğ‘¡1\displaystyle=\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t}-\eta\mathcal{U}(\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t};\zeta_{i,k}^{t})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x}^{t-1};\zeta_{i,k}^{t})+\bm{c}^{t};\bm{s}^{t-1}) (Mime client update)
=ğ’ši,kâˆ’1tâˆ’Î·â€‹ğ’°â€‹(âˆ‡fiâ€‹(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t;Î¶i,kt);ğ’”tâˆ’1).absentsuperscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘–ğ‘˜1ğ‘¡ğœ‚ğ’°âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘–ğ‘˜1ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğœğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡superscriptğ’”ğ‘¡1\displaystyle=\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t}-\eta\mathcal{U}(\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t};\zeta_{i,k}^{t});\bm{s}^{t-1})\,. (MimeLite client update)

After Kğ¾K such local updates, the server then aggregates the new client parameters as

ğ’™tsuperscriptğ’™ğ‘¡\displaystyle\bm{x}^{t} =1Sâ€‹âˆ‘iâˆˆğ’®tğ’ši,Ktabsent1ğ‘†subscriptğ‘–superscriptğ’®ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘–ğ¾ğ‘¡\displaystyle=\frac{1}{S}\sum_{i\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}\bm{y}_{i,K}^{t} (Update server parameters)
ğ’”tsuperscriptğ’”ğ‘¡\displaystyle\bm{s}^{t} =ğ’±â€‹(ğ’„t,ğ’”tâˆ’1).absentğ’±superscriptğ’„ğ‘¡superscriptğ’”ğ‘¡1\displaystyle=\mathcal{V}(\bm{c}^{t},\bm{s}^{t-1})\,. (Update server statistics)

F.1 Proof of TheoremÂ I (generic reduction)

Computing server update.
Lemma 5 (Deviation from central update.).

For a linear updater ğ’°ğ’°\mathcal{U} for both Mime and MimeLite the server update can be written as

ğ’™t=ğ’™tâˆ’1âˆ’Î·~â€‹ğ’°â€‹(1Sâ€‹âˆ‘iâˆ‡fiâ€‹(ğ’™)+ğ’†t;ğ’”tâˆ’1),superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡1~ğœ‚ğ’°1ğ‘†subscriptğ‘–âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–ğ’™superscriptğ’†ğ‘¡superscriptğ’”ğ‘¡1\bm{x}^{t}=\bm{x}^{t-1}-\tilde{\eta}\mathcal{U}\left(\frac{1}{S}\sum_{i}\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x})+\hbox{\pagecolor{myred!30}\text{$\bm{e}^{t}$}};\bm{s}^{t-1}\right)\,,

for Î·~:=Kâ€‹Î·assign~ğœ‚ğ¾ğœ‚\tilde{\eta}:=K\eta and ğt=1Kâ€‹Sâ€‹âˆ‘i,k(âˆ‡fiâ€‹(ğ²i,kâˆ’1;Î¶i,k)âˆ’âˆ‡fiâ€‹(ğ±;Î¶i,k))superscriptğğ‘¡1ğ¾ğ‘†subscriptğ‘–ğ‘˜âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–subscriptğ²ğ‘–ğ‘˜1subscriptğœğ‘–ğ‘˜âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–ğ±subscriptğœğ‘–ğ‘˜\hbox{\pagecolor{myred!30}\text{$\bm{e}^{t}$}}=\frac{1}{KS}\sum_{i,k}(\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k-1};\zeta_{i,k})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x};\zeta_{i,k})).

Proof.

Because the updater ğ’°ğ’°\mathcal{U} is linear in its first parameter, we can rewrite the update to the server for MimeLite as

ğ’™tâˆ’ğ’™tâˆ’1superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡1\displaystyle\bm{x}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-1} =1Sâ€‹âˆ‘iâˆˆğ’®tâˆ‘k=1Kâˆ’Î·â€‹ğ’°â€‹(âˆ‡fiâ€‹(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t;Î¶i,kt);ğ’”tâˆ’1)absent1ğ‘†subscriptğ‘–superscriptğ’®ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ¾ğœ‚ğ’°âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–subscriptsuperscriptğ’šğ‘¡ğ‘–ğ‘˜1subscriptsuperscriptğœğ‘¡ğ‘–ğ‘˜superscriptğ’”ğ‘¡1\displaystyle=\frac{1}{S}\sum_{i\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}\sum_{k=1}^{K}-\eta\mathcal{U}(\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}^{t}_{i,k-1};\zeta^{t}_{i,k});\bm{s}^{t-1})
=Î·â€‹Kâ€‹ğ’°â€‹(1Kâ€‹Sâ€‹âˆ‘i,kâˆ‡fiâ€‹(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t;Î¶i,kt);ğ’”tâˆ’1)absentğœ‚ğ¾ğ’°1ğ¾ğ‘†subscriptğ‘–ğ‘˜âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–subscriptsuperscriptğ’šğ‘¡ğ‘–ğ‘˜1subscriptsuperscriptğœğ‘¡ğ‘–ğ‘˜superscriptğ’”ğ‘¡1\displaystyle=\eta K\mathcal{U}\left(\frac{1}{KS}\sum_{i,k}\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}^{t}_{i,k-1};\zeta^{t}_{i,k});\bm{s}^{t-1}\right)

We drop the dependence on tğ‘¡t when obvious from context and iğ‘–i by default sums over ğ’®tsuperscriptğ’®ğ‘¡\mathcal{S}^{t} and kğ‘˜k over [K]delimited-[]ğ¾[K] by default. Since Kğ¾K represents a multiple of epochs, we have âˆ‘kâˆ‡fiâ€‹(ğ’™;Î¶i,kt)=Kâ€‹âˆ‡fiâ€‹(ğ’™)subscriptğ‘˜âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–ğ’™subscriptsuperscriptğœğ‘¡ğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ¾âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–ğ’™\sum_{k}\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x};\zeta^{t}_{i,k})=K\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x}). Continuing,

ğ’™tâˆ’ğ’™tâˆ’1superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡1\displaystyle\bm{x}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-1} =Î·â€‹Kâ€‹ğ’°â€‹(1Kâ€‹Sâ€‹âˆ‘i,kâˆ‡fiâ€‹(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t;Î¶i,kt);ğ’”tâˆ’1)absentğœ‚ğ¾ğ’°1ğ¾ğ‘†subscriptğ‘–ğ‘˜âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–subscriptsuperscriptğ’šğ‘¡ğ‘–ğ‘˜1subscriptsuperscriptğœğ‘¡ğ‘–ğ‘˜superscriptğ’”ğ‘¡1\displaystyle=\eta K\mathcal{U}\left(\frac{1}{KS}\sum_{i,k}\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}^{t}_{i,k-1};\zeta^{t}_{i,k});\bm{s}^{t-1}\right)
=Î·~â€‹ğ’°â€‹(1Sâ€‹âˆ‘iâˆ‡fiâ€‹(ğ’™)+ğ’†t;ğ’”tâˆ’1)absent~ğœ‚ğ’°1ğ‘†subscriptğ‘–âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–ğ’™superscriptğ’†ğ‘¡superscriptğ’”ğ‘¡1\displaystyle=\tilde{\eta}\mathcal{U}\left(\frac{1}{S}\sum_{i}\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x})+\bm{e}^{t};\bm{s}^{t-1}\right)

where

ğ’†t=1Kâ€‹Sâ€‹âˆ‘i,k(âˆ‡fiâ€‹(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1;Î¶i,k)âˆ’âˆ‡fiâ€‹(ğ’™;Î¶i,k))superscriptğ’†ğ‘¡1ğ¾ğ‘†subscriptğ‘–ğ‘˜âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–subscriptğ’šğ‘–ğ‘˜1subscriptğœğ‘–ğ‘˜âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–ğ’™subscriptğœğ‘–ğ‘˜\bm{e}^{t}=\frac{1}{KS}\sum_{i,k}(\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k-1};\zeta_{i,k})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x};\zeta_{i,k}))

Now let us examine the update of Mime. Again assuming Kğ¾K is a multiple of epoch, we have âˆ‘i,kâˆ‡fiâ€‹(ğ’™;Î¶i,kt)=Kâ€‹âˆ‘iâˆ‡fiâ€‹(ğ’™)=Kâ€‹Sâ€‹ğ’™subscriptğ‘–ğ‘˜âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–ğ’™subscriptsuperscriptğœğ‘¡ğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ¾subscriptğ‘–âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–ğ’™ğ¾ğ‘†ğ’™\sum_{i,k}\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x};\zeta^{t}_{i,k})=K\sum_{i}\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x})=KS\bm{x}. Hence,

ğ’™tâˆ’ğ’™tâˆ’1superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡1\displaystyle\bm{x}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-1} =1Sâ€‹âˆ‘iâˆˆğ’®tâˆ‘k=1Kâˆ’Î·â€‹ğ’°â€‹(âˆ‡fiâ€‹(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1;Î¶i,kt)âˆ’âˆ‡fiâ€‹(ğ’™;Î¶i,kt)+ğ’„;ğ’”tâˆ’1)absent1ğ‘†subscriptğ‘–superscriptğ’®ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ¾ğœ‚ğ’°âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–subscriptğ’šğ‘–ğ‘˜1subscriptsuperscriptğœğ‘¡ğ‘–ğ‘˜âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–ğ’™subscriptsuperscriptğœğ‘¡ğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ’„superscriptğ’”ğ‘¡1\displaystyle=\frac{1}{S}\sum_{i\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}\sum_{k=1}^{K}-\eta\mathcal{U}(\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k-1};\zeta^{t}_{i,k})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x};\zeta^{t}_{i,k})+\bm{c};\bm{s}^{t-1})
=Î·â€‹Kâ€‹ğ’°â€‹(1Kâ€‹Sâ€‹âˆ‘i,kâˆ‡fiâ€‹(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t;Î¶i,kt);ğ’”tâˆ’1)absentğœ‚ğ¾ğ’°1ğ¾ğ‘†subscriptğ‘–ğ‘˜âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–subscriptsuperscriptğ’šğ‘¡ğ‘–ğ‘˜1subscriptsuperscriptğœğ‘¡ğ‘–ğ‘˜superscriptğ’”ğ‘¡1\displaystyle=\eta K\mathcal{U}\left(\frac{1}{KS}\sum_{i,k}\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}^{t}_{i,k-1};\zeta^{t}_{i,k});\bm{s}^{t-1}\right)
=Î·â€‹Kâ€‹ğ’°â€‹(1Sâ€‹âˆ‘iâˆ‡fiâ€‹(ğ’™)+ğ’†t;ğ’”tâˆ’1).absentğœ‚ğ¾ğ’°1ğ‘†subscriptğ‘–âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–ğ’™superscriptğ’†ğ‘¡superscriptğ’”ğ‘¡1\displaystyle=\eta K\mathcal{U}\left(\frac{1}{S}\sum_{i}\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x})+\bm{e}^{t};\bm{s}^{t-1}\right)\,.

Thus we showed the lemma for both Mime and MimeLite. âˆ

Lemma 6 (Defining error).

For ğtsuperscriptğğ‘¡\bm{e}^{t} defined in LemmaÂ 5, assuming all functions fiâ€‹(â‹…,Î¶)subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–â‹…ğœf_{i}(\,\cdot\,,\zeta) are Lğ¿L-smooth, we have

ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ¥2â‰¤L21Kâ€‹Sâˆ‘i,kğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’ši,kâˆ’1âˆ’ğ’™âˆ¥2âŸ=â£:â„°Kt.\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}\leq L^{2}\underbrace{\frac{1}{KS}\sum_{i,k}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}}_{=:\mathcal{E}_{K}^{t}}\,.
Proof.

Using the smoothness of the individual functions and the definition of ğ’†tsuperscriptğ’†ğ‘¡\bm{e}^{t},

ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ¥2\displaystyle\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2} =ğ”¼âˆ¥1Kâ€‹Sâˆ‘i,k(âˆ‡fi(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1;Î¶i,k)âˆ’âˆ‡fi(ğ’™;Î¶i,k))âˆ¥2\displaystyle=\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\frac{1}{KS}\sum_{i,k}(\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k-1};\zeta_{i,k})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x};\zeta_{i,k}))\rVert^{2}
â‰¤1Kâ€‹Sâˆ‘i,kğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡fi(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1;Î¶i,k)âˆ’âˆ‡fi(ğ’™;Î¶i,k)âˆ¥2â‰¤L2â„°Kt.\displaystyle\leq\frac{1}{KS}\sum_{i,k}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k-1};\zeta_{i,k})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x};\zeta_{i,k})\rVert^{2}\leq L^{2}\mathcal{E}^{t}_{K}\,.

âˆ

Henceforth, we will call â„°Ktsubscriptsuperscriptâ„°ğ‘¡ğ¾\mathcal{E}^{t}_{K} as the error, or as the client-drift following [30].

Bounding error in MimeLite.

Now we will try bound the client drift â„°tsuperscriptâ„°ğ‘¡\mathcal{E}^{t} for MimeLite.

Lemma 7 (MimeLite error).

Suppose that all functions fiâ€‹(â‹…,Î¶)subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–â‹…ğœf_{i}(\,\cdot\,,\zeta) are Lğ¿L-smooth ((A2*)), Ïƒ2superscriptğœ2\sigma^{2} variance ((A3)), and ((A1)) is satisfied, and the updater ğ’°ğ’°\mathcal{U} has BğµB-Lipschitz updates. Then using step-size Î·~â‰¤12â€‹Bâ€‹L~ğœ‚12ğµğ¿\tilde{\eta}\leq\frac{1}{2BL},

118â€‹B2â€‹Î·~2â„°Kâ‰¤ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’™)âˆ¥2+G2+Ïƒ22â€‹K.\frac{1}{18B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}}\mathcal{E}^{K}\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x})\rVert^{2}+G^{2}+\frac{\sigma^{2}}{2K}\,.
Proof.

For K=1ğ¾1K=1, we have ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’ši,1âˆ’ğ’™âˆ¥2â‰¤B2Î·2(G2+Ïƒ2)+B2Î·2ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’™)âˆ¥2\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,1}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}\leq B^{2}\eta^{2}(G^{2}+\sigma^{2})+B^{2}\eta^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x})\rVert^{2}. The lemma is easily shown to be true. Assuming Kâ‰¥2ğ¾2K\geq 2 henceforth, and starting from the client update of MimeLite we have

ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’ši,kâˆ’ğ’™âˆ¥2\displaystyle\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2} =ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’ši,kâˆ’1âˆ’Î·ğ’°(âˆ‡fi(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t;Î¶i,kt);ğ’”tâˆ’1)âˆ’ğ’™âˆ¥2\displaystyle=\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}-\eta\mathcal{U}(\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t};\zeta_{i,k}^{t});\bm{s}^{t-1})-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}
â‰¤ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’ši,kâˆ’1âˆ’Î·ğ’°(âˆ‡fi(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t;ğ’”tâˆ’1)âˆ’ğ’™âˆ¥2+B2Î·2Ïƒ2\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}-\eta\mathcal{U}(\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t};\bm{s}^{t-1})-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}+B^{2}\eta^{2}\sigma^{2}
â‰¤(1+1Kâˆ’1)ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’ši,kâˆ’1âˆ’ğ’™âˆ¥2+KÎ·2ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’°(âˆ‡fi(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t;ğ’”tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2+B2Î·2Ïƒ2\displaystyle\leq\left(1+\frac{1}{K-1}\right)\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}+K\eta^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\mathcal{U}(\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t};\bm{s}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+B^{2}\eta^{2}\sigma^{2}
â‰¤(1+1Kâˆ’1)ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’ši,kâˆ’1âˆ’ğ’™âˆ¥2+KB2Î·2ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡fi(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1)Â±âˆ‡fi(ğ’™)âˆ¥2+B2Î·2Ïƒ2\displaystyle\leq\left(1+\frac{1}{K-1}\right)\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}+KB^{2}\eta^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k-1})\pm\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x})\rVert^{2}+B^{2}\eta^{2}\sigma^{2}
â‰¤(1+1Kâˆ’1)ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’ši,kâˆ’1âˆ’ğ’™âˆ¥2\displaystyle\leq\left(1+\frac{1}{K-1}\right)\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}
+2KB2Î·2ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡fi(ğ’™)âˆ¥2+2KB2L2Î·2ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’ši,kâˆ’1âˆ’ğ’™âˆ¥2+B2Î·2Ïƒ2\displaystyle\hskip 56.9055pt+2KB^{2}\eta^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x})\rVert^{2}+2KB^{2}L^{2}\eta^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}+B^{2}\eta^{2}\sigma^{2}
â‰¤(1+2Kâˆ’1)ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’ši,kâˆ’1âˆ’ğ’™âˆ¥2+2KB2Î·2ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’™)âˆ¥2+2KB2Î·2G2+B2Î·2Ïƒ2.\displaystyle\leq\left(1+\frac{2}{K-1}\right)\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}+2KB^{2}\eta^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x})\rVert^{2}+2KB^{2}\eta^{2}G^{2}+B^{2}\eta^{2}\sigma^{2}\,.

Here, we used the condition on our step size that Î·~=Kâ€‹Î·â‰¤12â€‹Lâ€‹B~ğœ‚ğ¾ğœ‚12ğ¿ğµ\tilde{\eta}=K\eta\leq\frac{1}{2LB}, which implies that 2â€‹Kâ€‹B2â€‹L2â€‹Î·2â‰¤1Kâˆ’12ğ¾superscriptğµ2superscriptğ¿2superscriptğœ‚21ğ¾12KB^{2}L^{2}\eta^{2}\leq\frac{1}{K-1}. Unrolling this recursion, we have

ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’ši,kâˆ’ğ’™âˆ¥2â‰¤(2KB2Î·2ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’™)âˆ¥2+2KB2Î·2G2+B2Î·2Ïƒ2)âˆ‘k=1K(1+2Kâˆ’1)k.\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}\leq\left(2KB^{2}\eta^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x})\rVert^{2}+2KB^{2}\eta^{2}G^{2}+B^{2}\eta^{2}\sigma^{2}\right)\sum_{k=1}^{K}\left(1+\frac{2}{K-1}\right)^{k}\,.

Note that (1+2Kâˆ’1)kâ‰¤9superscript12ğ¾1ğ‘˜9\left(1+\frac{2}{K-1}\right)^{k}\leq 9. Averaging then over kğ‘˜k and iğ‘–i, we get

â„°Ktâ‰¤18K2B2Î·2ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’™)âˆ¥2+18K2B2Î·2G2+9KB2Î·2Ïƒ2.\mathcal{E}^{t}_{K}\leq 18K^{2}B^{2}\eta^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x})\rVert^{2}+18K^{2}B^{2}\eta^{2}G^{2}+9KB^{2}\eta^{2}\sigma^{2}\,.

Finally, recalling that Î·~=Kâ€‹Î·~ğœ‚ğ¾ğœ‚\tilde{\eta}=K\eta finishes the lemma. âˆ

Bounding error in Mime.

Next we will try bound the client drift â„°tsuperscriptâ„°ğ‘¡\mathcal{E}^{t} for Mime. The additional SVRG correction term used in Mime improves the bound on the error.

Lemma 8 (Mime Error).

Suppose that all functions fiâ€‹(â‹…,Î¶)subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–â‹…ğœf_{i}(\,\cdot\,,\zeta) are Lğ¿L-smooth ((A2*)), Ïƒ2superscriptğœ2\sigma^{2} variance ((A3)), and ((A1)) is satisfied, and the updater ğ’°ğ’°\mathcal{U} has BğµB-Lipschitz updates. Then using step-size Î·~â‰¤12â€‹Bâ€‹L~ğœ‚12ğµğ¿\tilde{\eta}\leq\frac{1}{2BL},

â„°Kâ‰¤18B2Î·~2ğ”¼âˆ¥1Sâˆ‘iâˆ‡if(ğ’™)âˆ¥2.\mathcal{E}^{K}\leq 18B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\left\lVert\frac{1}{S}\sum_{i}\nabla_{i}f(\bm{x})\right\rVert^{2}\,.
Proof.

For K=1ğ¾1K=1, the Mime update loos like

ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’ši,1âˆ’ğ’™âˆ¥2\displaystyle\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,1}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2} =Î·2ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’°(ğ’„;ğ’”tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2\displaystyle=\eta^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\mathcal{U}\left(\bm{c};\bm{s}^{t-1}\right)\rVert^{2}
â‰¤Î·2B2ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’„âˆ¥2.\displaystyle\leq\eta^{2}B^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{c}\rVert^{2}\,.

Assuming Kâ‰¥2ğ¾2K\geq 2 henceforth, and starting from the client update of Mime we have

ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’ši,kâˆ’ğ’™âˆ¥2\displaystyle\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2} =ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’ši,kâˆ’1âˆ’Î·ğ’°(âˆ‡fi(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1;Î¶i,kt)âˆ’âˆ‡fi(ğ’™;Î¶i,kt)+ğ’„t;ğ’”tâˆ’1)âˆ’ğ’™âˆ¥2\displaystyle=\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}-\eta\mathcal{U}(\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k-1};\zeta_{i,k}^{t})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x};\zeta_{i,k}^{t})+\bm{c}^{t};\bm{s}^{t-1})-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}
â‰¤(1+1Kâˆ’1)ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’ši,kâˆ’1âˆ’ğ’™âˆ¥2\displaystyle\leq\left(1+\frac{1}{K-1}\right)\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}
+KÎ·2ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’°(âˆ‡fi(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1;Î¶i,kt)âˆ’âˆ‡fi(ğ’™;Î¶i,kt)+ğ’„t;ğ’”tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2\displaystyle\hskip 56.9055pt+K\eta^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\mathcal{U}(\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k-1};\zeta_{i,k}^{t})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x};\zeta_{i,k}^{t})+\bm{c}^{t};\bm{s}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}
â‰¤(1+1Kâˆ’1)ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’ši,kâˆ’1âˆ’ğ’™âˆ¥2+KÎ·2B2ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡fi(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1;Î¶i,kt)âˆ’âˆ‡fi(ğ’™;Î¶i,kt)+ğ’„tâˆ¥2\displaystyle\leq\left(1+\frac{1}{K-1}\right)\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}+K\eta^{2}B^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k-1};\zeta_{i,k}^{t})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x};\zeta_{i,k}^{t})+\bm{c}^{t}\rVert^{2}
â‰¤(1+1Kâˆ’1)ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’ši,kâˆ’1âˆ’ğ’™âˆ¥2\displaystyle\leq\left(1+\frac{1}{K-1}\right)\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}
+2KÎ·2B2ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡fi(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1;Î¶i,kt)âˆ’âˆ‡fi(ğ’™;Î¶i,kt)âˆ¥2+2KÎ·2B2ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’„tâˆ¥2\displaystyle\hskip 56.9055pt+2K\eta^{2}B^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k-1};\zeta_{i,k}^{t})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x};\zeta_{i,k}^{t})\rVert^{2}+2K\eta^{2}B^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{c}^{t}\rVert^{2}
â‰¤(1+1Kâˆ’1+2KÎ·2B2L2)ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’ši,kâˆ’1âˆ’ğ’™âˆ¥2+2KÎ·2B2ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’„tâˆ¥2\displaystyle\leq\left(1+\frac{1}{K-1}+2K\eta^{2}B^{2}L^{2}\right)\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}+2K\eta^{2}B^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{c}^{t}\rVert^{2}
â‰¤(1+2Kâˆ’1)ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’ši,kâˆ’1âˆ’ğ’™âˆ¥2+2KÎ·2B2ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’„tâˆ¥2.\displaystyle\leq\left(1+\frac{2}{K-1}\right)\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}+2K\eta^{2}B^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{c}^{t}\rVert^{2}\,.

Here, we used the condition on our step size that Î·~=Kâ€‹Î·â‰¤12â€‹Lâ€‹B~ğœ‚ğ¾ğœ‚12ğ¿ğµ\tilde{\eta}=K\eta\leq\frac{1}{2LB}, which implies that 2â€‹Kâ€‹B2â€‹L2â€‹Î·2â‰¤1Kâˆ’12ğ¾superscriptğµ2superscriptğ¿2superscriptğœ‚21ğ¾12KB^{2}L^{2}\eta^{2}\leq\frac{1}{K-1}. Unrolling this recursion, we have

ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’ši,kâˆ’ğ’™âˆ¥2â‰¤2KB2Î·2ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’„tâˆ¥2âˆ‘k=1K(1+2Kâˆ’1)kâ‰¤18K2B2Î·2ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’„tâˆ¥2.\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}\leq 2KB^{2}\eta^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{c}^{t}\rVert^{2}\sum_{k=1}^{K}\left(1+\frac{2}{K-1}\right)^{k}\leq 18K^{2}B^{2}\eta^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{c}^{t}\rVert^{2}\,.

Note that (1+2Kâˆ’1)kâ‰¤9superscript12ğ¾1ğ‘˜9\left(1+\frac{2}{K-1}\right)^{k}\leq 9. Averaging then over kğ‘˜k and iğ‘–i, recalling that Î·~=Kâ€‹Î·~ğœ‚ğ¾ğœ‚\tilde{\eta}=K\eta get

â„°Ktâ‰¤18B2Î·~2ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’„tâˆ¥2.\mathcal{E}^{t}_{K}\leq 18B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{c}^{t}\rVert^{2}\,.

âˆ

Putting it together (TheoremÂ I).
Lemma 9.

The updates of Mime and MimeLite for ğœtsuperscriptğœğ‘¡\bm{c}^{t} satisfying ğ”¼[ğœt]=âˆ‡f(ğ±tâˆ’1)Â andÂ ğ”¼âˆ¥ğœtâˆ’âˆ‡f(ğ±tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2â‰¤G2S\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}[\bm{c}^{t}]=\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\text{ and }\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{c}^{t}-\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}\leq\frac{G^{2}}{S}, we have for Î·~â‰¤12â€‹Bâ€‹L~ğœ‚12ğµğ¿\tilde{\eta}\leq\frac{1}{2BL}

ğ’™tsuperscriptğ’™ğ‘¡\displaystyle\bm{x}^{t} =ğ’™tâˆ’1âˆ’Î·~â€‹ğ’°â€‹(ğ’„t+ğ’†t;ğ’”tâˆ’1)absentsuperscriptğ’™ğ‘¡1~ğœ‚ğ’°superscriptğ’„ğ‘¡superscriptğ’†ğ‘¡superscriptğ’”ğ‘¡1\displaystyle=\bm{x}^{t-1}-\tilde{\eta}\mathcal{U}(\bm{c}^{t}+\bm{e}^{t};\bm{s}^{t-1})
ğ’”tsuperscriptğ’”ğ‘¡\displaystyle\bm{s}^{t} =ğ’±â€‹(ğ’„t;ğ’”tâˆ’1).absentğ’±superscriptğ’„ğ‘¡superscriptğ’”ğ‘¡1\displaystyle=\mathcal{V}(\bm{c}^{t};\bm{s}^{t-1})\,.

Where, we have

118â€‹B2â€‹L2â€‹Î·~2ğ”¼tâˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ¥2â‰¤{ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’„tâˆ¥2MimeÂ ,ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’™t)âˆ¥2+G2+Ïƒ22â€‹KMimeLite.\tfrac{1}{18B^{2}L^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}_{t}\lVert\text{\hbox{\pagecolor{myred!30}$\bm{e}_{t}$}}\rVert^{2}\leq\begin{cases}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{c}_{t}\rVert^{2}&\text{\hbox{\pagecolor{myblue!30}{\sc Mime}}\,,}\\ \operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t})\rVert^{2}+G^{2}+\frac{\sigma^{2}}{2K}&\text{\hbox{\pagecolor{mygreen!30}{\sc MimeLite}}.}\end{cases}
Proof.

Now, combining LemmasÂ 5,Â 6, shows that running Mime or MimeLite is equivalent to

ğ’™tsuperscriptğ’™ğ‘¡\displaystyle\bm{x}^{t} =ğ’™tâˆ’1âˆ’Î·~â€‹ğ’°â€‹(ğ’„t+ğ’†t;ğ’”tâˆ’1)absentsuperscriptğ’™ğ‘¡1~ğœ‚ğ’°superscriptğ’„ğ‘¡superscriptğ’†ğ‘¡superscriptğ’”ğ‘¡1\displaystyle=\bm{x}^{t-1}-\tilde{\eta}\mathcal{U}(\bm{c}^{t}+\bm{e}^{t};\bm{s}^{t-1})
ğ’”tsuperscriptğ’”ğ‘¡\displaystyle\bm{s}^{t} =ğ’±â€‹(ğ’„t;ğ’”tâˆ’1),absentğ’±superscriptğ’„ğ‘¡superscriptğ’”ğ‘¡1\displaystyle=\mathcal{V}(\bm{c}^{t};\bm{s}^{t-1})\,,

where

ğ”¼[ğ’„t]=âˆ‡f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)Â andÂ ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’„tâˆ’âˆ‡f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2â‰¤G2S.\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}[\bm{c}^{t}]=\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\text{ and }\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{c}^{t}-\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}\leq\frac{G^{2}}{S}\,.

This shows the first part of the theorem. For the second part of the theorem, using the bound from LemmaÂ 8 for Mime,

ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ¥â‰¤L2â„°Ktâ‰¤18L2B2Î·~2ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’„tâˆ¥2.\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert\leq L^{2}\mathcal{E}^{t}_{K}\leq 18L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{c}^{t}\rVert^{2}\,.

For MimeLite, we will instead use the bound from LemmaÂ 7,

ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ¥â‰¤L2â„°Ktâ‰¤18L2B2Î·~2ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’™t)âˆ¥2+18L2B2Î·~2G2+9â€‹L2â€‹B2â€‹Î·~2â€‹Ïƒ2K.\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert\leq L^{2}\mathcal{E}^{t}_{K}\leq 18L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t})\rVert^{2}+18L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}+\frac{9L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}\sigma^{2}}{K}\,.

âˆ

Note that the Lemma we proved here is slightly stronger than the theorem in the main section (up to constants which were suppressed).

F.2 Convergence of MimeSGD and MimeLiteSGD (CorollaryÂ II)

TheoremÂ I shows that Mime and MimeLite mimic a centralized algorithm quite closely up to error ğ’ªâ€‹(Î·~2)ğ’ªsuperscript~ğœ‚2\mathcal{O}(\tilde{\eta}^{2}). Then, analyzing the sensitivity of the base algorithm to such perturbation yields specific rates of convergence. We perform such an analysis using SGD as our base optimizer.

Properties of SGD as the base optimizer:

  • â€¢

    ğ’”tsuperscriptğ’”ğ‘¡\bm{s}^{t} is empty i.e. there are no global statistics used.

  • â€¢

    ğ’°â€‹(ğ’ˆ;ğ’”tâˆ’1)=ğ’ˆğ’°ğ’ˆsuperscriptğ’”ğ‘¡1ğ’ˆ\mathcal{U}(\bm{g};\bm{s}^{t-1})=\bm{g} for any ğ’ˆğ’ˆ\bm{g} and B=1ğµ1B=1.

With this in mind, we proceed.

Lemma 10 (Progress in one round).

Given that fğ‘“f is Lğ¿L-smooth, and for any step-size Î·~â‰¤12â€‹(B+2)â€‹L~ğœ‚12ğµ2ğ¿\tilde{\eta}\leq\frac{1}{2(B+2)L} for Bâ‰¥1ğµ1B\geq 1 we have

f(ğ’™t)â‰¤f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ’Î·~4ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2+Î·~ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ¥2+Lâ€‹Î·~2â€‹G2S.f(\bm{x}^{t})\leq f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{4}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\tilde{\eta}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}+\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}}{S}\,.
Proof.

Starting from the update equation and the smoothness of fğ‘“f, we have

ğ”¼â¡fâ€‹(ğ’™t)ğ”¼ğ‘“superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡\displaystyle\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t}) â‰¤ğ”¼f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)+ğ”¼âŸ¨âˆ‡f(ğ’™tâˆ’1),ğ’™tâˆ’ğ’™tâˆ’1âŸ©+L2ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’™tâˆ’ğ’™tâˆ’1âˆ¥2\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})+\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\langle\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1}),\bm{x}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-1}\rangle+\frac{L}{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{x}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}
=ğ”¼f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ’Î·~ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2+Î·~âŸ¨âˆ‡f(ğ’™tâˆ’1),ğ’†tâŸ©+Lâ€‹Î·~22ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’„t+ğ’†tâˆ¥2\displaystyle=\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\tilde{\eta}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\tilde{\eta}\langle\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1}),\bm{e}^{t}\rangle+\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}}{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{c}^{t}+\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}
â‰¤ğ”¼f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ’Î·~2ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2+Î·~2âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ¥2+2â€‹Lâ€‹Î·~22ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’„tâˆ¥2+2â€‹Lâ€‹Î·~22ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ¥2\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{2}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}+\frac{2L\tilde{\eta}^{2}}{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{c}^{t}\rVert^{2}+\frac{2L\tilde{\eta}^{2}}{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}
â‰¤ğ”¼f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ’(Î·~2âˆ’2â€‹Lâ€‹Î·~22)ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2+(LÎ·~2+Î·~2)ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ¥2+2â€‹Lâ€‹Î·~2â€‹G22â€‹S.\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\left(\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{2}-\frac{2L\tilde{\eta}^{2}}{2}\right)\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\left(L\tilde{\eta}^{2}+\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{2}\right)\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}+\frac{2L\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}}{2S}\,.

Using the bound on the step size that Î·~â‰¤14â€‹L~ğœ‚14ğ¿\tilde{\eta}\leq\frac{1}{4L} yields the lemma. âˆ

One round progress for MimeSGD.

Next, we specialize the convergence rate for Mime.

Lemma 11.

Suppose fğ‘“f is a Lğ¿L-smooth function satisfying PL-inequality for Î¼â‰¥0ğœ‡0\mu\geq 0 (Î¼=0ğœ‡0\mu=0 corresponds to the general case). Running MimeSGD for Î·~â‰¤112â€‹Bâ€‹L~ğœ‚112ğµğ¿\tilde{\eta}\leq\frac{1}{12BL} satisfies

Î·~16ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2â‰¤(1âˆ’Î¼â€‹Î·~8)(f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ’fâ‹†)âˆ’(f(ğ’™t)âˆ’fâ‹†)+3â€‹Lâ€‹Î·~2â€‹G2S.\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{16}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}\leq(1-\tfrac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8})(f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-f^{\star})-(f(\bm{x}^{t})-f^{\star})+\frac{3L\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}}{S}\,.
Proof.

Recall from LemmaÂ 9 that for Mime,

ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ¥2â‰¤18L2B2Î·~2ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’„tâˆ¥2â‰¤18L2B2Î·~2ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2+18â€‹L2â€‹B2â€‹Î·~2â€‹G2S.\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}\leq 18L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{c}^{t}\rVert^{2}\leq 18L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\frac{18L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}}{S}\,.

Combining this with LemmaÂ 10 yields the following progress for Mime

fâ€‹(ğ’™t)ğ‘“superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡\displaystyle f(\bm{x}^{t}) â‰¤f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ’(Î·~4âˆ’18L2B2Î·~3)ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2+(Lâ€‹Î·~2+18â€‹L2â€‹B2â€‹Î·~3)â€‹G2S\displaystyle\leq f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\left(\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{4}-18L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{3}\right)\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\frac{(L\tilde{\eta}^{2}+18L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{3})G^{2}}{S}
â‰¤f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ’Î·~8ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2+3â€‹Lâ€‹Î·~2â€‹G2S.\displaystyle\leq f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{8}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\frac{3L\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}}{S}\,.

Here, we used the bound on the step size that Î·~â‰¤112â€‹Lâ€‹B~ğœ‚112ğ¿ğµ\tilde{\eta}\leq\frac{1}{12LB} implies 18â€‹L2â€‹B2â€‹Î·~2â‰¤1818superscriptğ¿2superscriptğµ2superscript~ğœ‚21818L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}\leq\frac{1}{8}. Now using PL-inequality, we can write

fâ€‹(ğ’™t)âˆ’fâ‹†ğ‘“superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡superscriptğ‘“â‹†\displaystyle f(\bm{x}^{t})-f^{\star} â‰¤f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ’fâ‹†âˆ’Î¼â€‹Î·~8(f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ’fâ‹†)âˆ’Î·~16ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2+3â€‹Lâ€‹Î·~2â€‹G2S.\displaystyle\leq f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-f^{\star}-\frac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8}(f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-f^{\star})-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{16}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\frac{3L\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}}{S}\,.

This yields the lemma. âˆ

We are now ready to derive the convergence rate.

Convergence rate of MimeSGD on general non-convex functions.

Set Î¼=0ğœ‡0\mu=0 in LemmaÂ 11 and sum over tğ‘¡t

1Tâˆ‘t=1Tğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2\displaystyle\frac{1}{T}\sum_{t=1}^{T}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2} â‰¤16â€‹(fâ€‹(ğ’™0)âˆ’fâ‹†)Î·~â€‹T+48â€‹Lâ€‹Î·~â€‹G2Sabsent16ğ‘“superscriptğ’™0superscriptğ‘“â‹†~ğœ‚ğ‘‡48ğ¿~ğœ‚superscriptğº2ğ‘†\displaystyle\leq\frac{16(f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star})}{\tilde{\eta}T}+\frac{48L\tilde{\eta}G^{2}}{S}
â‰¤16â€‹3â€‹Lâ€‹G2â€‹(fâ€‹(ğ’™0)âˆ’fâ‹†)Sâ€‹T+192â€‹Bâ€‹Lâ€‹(fâ€‹(ğ’™0)âˆ’fâ‹†)T.absent163ğ¿superscriptğº2ğ‘“superscriptğ’™0superscriptğ‘“â‹†ğ‘†ğ‘‡192ğµğ¿ğ‘“superscriptğ’™0superscriptğ‘“â‹†ğ‘‡\displaystyle\leq 16\sqrt{\frac{3LG^{2}(f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star})}{ST}}+\frac{192BL(f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star})}{T}\,.

The final step used a step-size of Î·~=minâ¡(112â€‹Bâ€‹L,14â€‹L,Sâ€‹(fâ€‹(ğ’™0)âˆ’fâ‹†)3â€‹Lâ€‹Tâ€‹G2)~ğœ‚112ğµğ¿14ğ¿ğ‘†ğ‘“superscriptğ’™0superscriptğ‘“â‹†3ğ¿ğ‘‡superscriptğº2\tilde{\eta}=\min\left(\frac{1}{12BL},\frac{1}{4L},\sqrt{\frac{S(f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star})}{3LTG^{2}}}\right). Here, we used ğ’™out=ğ’™Ï„superscriptğ’™outsuperscriptğ’™ğœ\bm{x}^{\text{out}}=\bm{x}^{\tau} where Ï„ğœ\tau is uniformly at random chosen in [T]delimited-[]ğ‘‡[T].

Convergence rate of MimeSGD on PL-inequality.

Multiply LemmaÂ 11 by (1âˆ’Î¼â€‹Î·~8)Tâˆ’tsuperscript1ğœ‡~ğœ‚8ğ‘‡ğ‘¡(1-\tfrac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8})^{T-t} and sum over tğ‘¡t

âˆ‘t=1T(1âˆ’Î¼â€‹Î·~8)Tâˆ’tğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2\displaystyle\sum_{t=1}^{T}(1-\tfrac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8})^{T-t}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2} â‰¤âˆ‘t=1T(1âˆ’Î¼â€‹Î·~8)Tâˆ’(tâˆ’1)â€‹16â€‹(fâ€‹(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ’fâ‹†)Î·~absentsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¡1ğ‘‡superscript1ğœ‡~ğœ‚8ğ‘‡ğ‘¡116ğ‘“superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡1superscriptğ‘“â‹†~ğœ‚\displaystyle\leq\sum_{t=1}^{T}(1-\tfrac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8})^{T-(t-1)}\frac{16(f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-f^{\star})}{\tilde{\eta}}
âˆ’(1âˆ’Î¼â€‹Î·~8)Tâˆ’tâ€‹16â€‹(fâ€‹(ğ’™t)âˆ’fâ‹†)Î·~+(1âˆ’Î¼â€‹Î·~8)Tâˆ’tâ€‹48â€‹Lâ€‹Î·~â€‹G2Ssuperscript1ğœ‡~ğœ‚8ğ‘‡ğ‘¡16ğ‘“superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡superscriptğ‘“â‹†~ğœ‚superscript1ğœ‡~ğœ‚8ğ‘‡ğ‘¡48ğ¿~ğœ‚superscriptğº2ğ‘†\displaystyle\hskip 28.45274pt-(1-\tfrac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8})^{T-t}\frac{16(f(\bm{x}^{t})-f^{\star})}{\tilde{\eta}}+(1-\tfrac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8})^{T-t}\frac{48L\tilde{\eta}G^{2}}{S}
â‰¤(1âˆ’Î¼â€‹Î·~8)Tâ€‹16â€‹(fâ€‹(ğ’™0)âˆ’fâ‹†)Î·~+âˆ‘t=1T(1âˆ’Î¼â€‹Î·~8)Tâˆ’tâ€‹48â€‹Lâ€‹Î·~â€‹G2S.absentsuperscript1ğœ‡~ğœ‚8ğ‘‡16ğ‘“superscriptğ’™0superscriptğ‘“â‹†~ğœ‚superscriptsubscriptğ‘¡1ğ‘‡superscript1ğœ‡~ğœ‚8ğ‘‡ğ‘¡48ğ¿~ğœ‚superscriptğº2ğ‘†\displaystyle\leq(1-\tfrac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8})^{T}\frac{16(f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star})}{\tilde{\eta}}+\sum_{t=1}^{T}(1-\tfrac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8})^{T-t}\frac{48L\tilde{\eta}G^{2}}{S}\,.

Output ğ’™out=ğ’™Ï„superscriptğ’™outsuperscriptğ’™ğœ\bm{x}^{\text{out}}=\bm{x}^{\tau} where Ï„ğœ\tau is chosen with probability proportional to (1âˆ’Î¼â€‹Î·~8)Tâˆ’tsuperscript1ğœ‡~ğœ‚8ğ‘‡ğ‘¡(1-\tfrac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8})^{T-t}. Then, this yields

ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’™out)âˆ¥2â‰¤(1âˆ’Î¼â€‹Î·~8)T16â€‹(fâ€‹(ğ’™0)âˆ’fâ‹†)Î·~+48â€‹Lâ€‹Î·~â€‹G2Sâ‰¤ğ’ª~(Ïƒ2Î¼â€‹T+L(f(ğ’™0)âˆ’fâ‹†)exp(âˆ’Î¼â€‹T12â€‹Bâ€‹L)).\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{\text{out}})\rVert^{2}\leq(1-\tfrac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8})^{T}\frac{16(f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star})}{\tilde{\eta}}+\frac{48L\tilde{\eta}G^{2}}{S}\leq\tilde{\mathcal{O}}\left(\frac{\sigma^{2}}{\mu T}+L(f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star})\exp\left(-\frac{\mu T}{12BL}\right)\right)\,.

Using an appropriate step-size Î·~~ğœ‚\tilde{\eta} yields the final rate (see LemmaÂ 1 of [30]).

One round progress for MimeLiteSGD.

Next, we specialize the convergence rate for MimeLite.

Lemma 12.

Suppose fğ‘“f is a Lğ¿L-smooth function satisfying PL-inequality for Î¼â‰¥0ğœ‡0\mu\geq 0 (Î¼=0ğœ‡0\mu=0 corresponds to the general case). Running MimeLiteSGD for Î·~â‰¤112â€‹Bâ€‹L~ğœ‚112ğµğ¿\tilde{\eta}\leq\frac{1}{12BL} satisfies

Î·~16ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2â‰¤(1âˆ’Î¼â€‹Î·~8)(f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ’fâ‹†)âˆ’(f(ğ’™t)âˆ’fâ‹†)+Lâ€‹Î·~2â€‹G2S+18L2B2Î·~3(G2+Ïƒ2/K).\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{16}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}\leq(1-\tfrac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8})(f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-f^{\star})-(f(\bm{x}^{t})-f^{\star})+\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}}{S}+18L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{3}\left(G^{2}+\sigma^{2}/K\right)\,.
Proof.

Recall from LemmaÂ 9 that,

ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ¥2â‰¤18L2B2Î·~2ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’„tâˆ¥2â‰¤18L2B2Î·~2ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2+18L2B2Î·~2G2+9â€‹L2â€‹B2â€‹Î·~2â€‹Ïƒ2K.\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}\leq 18L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{c}^{t}\rVert^{2}\leq 18L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+18L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}+\frac{9L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}\sigma^{2}}{K}\,.

Combining this with LemmaÂ 10 yields the following progress for Mime

fâ€‹(ğ’™t)ğ‘“superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡\displaystyle f(\bm{x}^{t}) â‰¤f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ’(Î·~4âˆ’18L2B2Î·~3)ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2+Lâ€‹Î·~2â€‹G2S+18L2B2Î·~3(G2+Ïƒ2/K)\displaystyle\leq f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\left(\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{4}-18L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{3}\right)\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}}{S}+18L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{3}\left(G^{2}+\sigma^{2}/K\right)
â‰¤f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ’Î·~8ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2+Lâ€‹Î·~2â€‹G2S+18L2B2Î·~3(G2+Ïƒ2/K).\displaystyle\leq f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{8}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}}{S}+18L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{3}\left(G^{2}+\sigma^{2}/K\right)\,.

Here, we used the bound on the step size that Î·~â‰¤112â€‹Lâ€‹B~ğœ‚112ğ¿ğµ\tilde{\eta}\leq\frac{1}{12LB} implies 18â€‹L2â€‹B2â€‹Î·~2â‰¤1818superscriptğ¿2superscriptğµ2superscript~ğœ‚21818L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}\leq\frac{1}{8}. Now using PL-inequality, we can write

fâ€‹(ğ’™t)âˆ’fâ‹†âˆ’ğ‘“superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡limit-fromsuperscriptğ‘“â‹†\displaystyle f(\bm{x}^{t})-f^{\star}- (fâ€‹(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ’fâ‹†)â‰¤ğ‘“superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡1superscriptğ‘“â‹†absent\displaystyle(f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-f^{\star})\leq
âˆ’Î¼â€‹Î·~8(f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ’fâ‹†)âˆ’Î·~16ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2+Lâ€‹Î·~2â€‹G2S+18L2B2Î·~3(G2+Ïƒ2/K).\displaystyle-\frac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8}(f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-f^{\star})-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{16}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}}{S}+18L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{3}\left(G^{2}+\sigma^{2}/K\right)\,.

This yields the lemma. âˆ

We are now ready to derive the convergence rate.

Convergence rate of MimeLiteSGD on general non-convex functions.

Define G~2=G2+Ïƒ2/Ksuperscript~ğº2superscriptğº2superscriptğœ2ğ¾\tilde{G}^{2}=G^{2}+\sigma^{2}/K. Set Î¼=0ğœ‡0\mu=0 in LemmaÂ 12 and sum over tğ‘¡t

1Tâˆ‘t=1Tğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2\displaystyle\frac{1}{T}\sum_{t=1}^{T}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2} â‰¤16â€‹(fâ€‹(ğ’™0)âˆ’fâ‹†)Î·~â€‹T+16â€‹Lâ€‹Î·~â€‹G2S+288â€‹L2â€‹B2â€‹Î·~2â€‹G~2absent16ğ‘“superscriptğ’™0superscriptğ‘“â‹†~ğœ‚ğ‘‡16ğ¿~ğœ‚superscriptğº2ğ‘†288superscriptğ¿2superscriptğµ2superscript~ğœ‚2superscript~ğº2\displaystyle\leq\frac{16(f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star})}{\tilde{\eta}T}+\frac{16L\tilde{\eta}G^{2}}{S}+288L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}\tilde{G}^{2}
â‰¤16â€‹Lâ€‹G2â€‹(fâ€‹(ğ’™0)âˆ’fâ‹†)Sâ€‹T+84â€‹(Lâ€‹G~â€‹(fâ€‹(ğ’™0)âˆ’fâ‹†)T)2/3+192â€‹Bâ€‹Lâ€‹(fâ€‹(ğ’™0)âˆ’fâ‹†)T.absent16ğ¿superscriptğº2ğ‘“superscriptğ’™0superscriptğ‘“â‹†ğ‘†ğ‘‡84superscriptğ¿~ğºğ‘“superscriptğ’™0superscriptğ‘“â‹†ğ‘‡23192ğµğ¿ğ‘“superscriptğ’™0superscriptğ‘“â‹†ğ‘‡\displaystyle\leq 16\sqrt{\frac{LG^{2}(f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star})}{ST}}+84\left(\frac{L\tilde{G}(f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star})}{T}\right)^{2/3}+\frac{192BL(f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star})}{T}\,.

The final step used an appropriate step-size of Î·~~ğœ‚\tilde{\eta}, see Lemma 2 of [30]. Here, we used ğ’™out=ğ’™Ï„superscriptğ’™outsuperscriptğ’™ğœ\bm{x}^{\text{out}}=\bm{x}^{\tau} where Ï„ğœ\tau is uniformly at random chosen in [T]delimited-[]ğ‘‡[T]. Finally note that if Kâ‰¥Ïƒ2G2ğ¾superscriptğœ2superscriptğº2K\geq\frac{\sigma^{2}}{G^{2}}, then G~2â‰¤2â€‹G2superscript~ğº22superscriptğº2\tilde{G}^{2}\leq 2G^{2}.

Convergence rate of MimeLiteSGD on PL-inequality.

Multiply LemmaÂ 12 by (1âˆ’Î¼â€‹Î·~8)Tâˆ’tsuperscript1ğœ‡~ğœ‚8ğ‘‡ğ‘¡(1-\tfrac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8})^{T-t} and sum over tğ‘¡t

âˆ‘t=1T(1âˆ’Î¼â€‹Î·~8)Tâˆ’tğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2\displaystyle\sum_{t=1}^{T}(1-\tfrac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8})^{T-t}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2} â‰¤âˆ‘t=1T(1âˆ’Î¼â€‹Î·~8)Tâˆ’(tâˆ’1)â€‹16â€‹(fâ€‹(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ’fâ‹†)Î·~absentsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¡1ğ‘‡superscript1ğœ‡~ğœ‚8ğ‘‡ğ‘¡116ğ‘“superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡1superscriptğ‘“â‹†~ğœ‚\displaystyle\leq\sum_{t=1}^{T}(1-\tfrac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8})^{T-(t-1)}\frac{16(f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-f^{\star})}{\tilde{\eta}}
âˆ’(1âˆ’Î¼â€‹Î·~8)Tâˆ’tâ€‹16â€‹(fâ€‹(ğ’™t)âˆ’fâ‹†)Î·~superscript1ğœ‡~ğœ‚8ğ‘‡ğ‘¡16ğ‘“superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡superscriptğ‘“â‹†~ğœ‚\displaystyle\hskip 56.9055pt-(1-\tfrac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8})^{T-t}\frac{16(f(\bm{x}^{t})-f^{\star})}{\tilde{\eta}}
+âˆ‘t=1T(1âˆ’Î¼â€‹Î·~8)Tâˆ’tâ€‹(16â€‹Lâ€‹Î·~â€‹G2S+288â€‹L2â€‹B2â€‹Î·~2â€‹G~2)superscriptsubscriptğ‘¡1ğ‘‡superscript1ğœ‡~ğœ‚8ğ‘‡ğ‘¡16ğ¿~ğœ‚superscriptğº2ğ‘†288superscriptğ¿2superscriptğµ2superscript~ğœ‚2superscript~ğº2\displaystyle\hskip 56.9055pt+\sum_{t=1}^{T}(1-\tfrac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8})^{T-t}\left(\frac{16L\tilde{\eta}G^{2}}{S}+288L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}\tilde{G}^{2}\right)
â‰¤(1âˆ’Î¼â€‹Î·~8)Tâ€‹16â€‹(fâ€‹(ğ’™0)âˆ’fâ‹†)Î·~absentsuperscript1ğœ‡~ğœ‚8ğ‘‡16ğ‘“superscriptğ’™0superscriptğ‘“â‹†~ğœ‚\displaystyle\leq(1-\tfrac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8})^{T}\frac{16(f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star})}{\tilde{\eta}}
+âˆ‘t=1T(1âˆ’Î¼â€‹Î·~8)Tâˆ’tâ€‹(16â€‹Lâ€‹Î·~â€‹G2S+288â€‹L2â€‹B2â€‹Î·~2â€‹G~2).superscriptsubscriptğ‘¡1ğ‘‡superscript1ğœ‡~ğœ‚8ğ‘‡ğ‘¡16ğ¿~ğœ‚superscriptğº2ğ‘†288superscriptğ¿2superscriptğµ2superscript~ğœ‚2superscript~ğº2\displaystyle\hskip 56.9055pt+\sum_{t=1}^{T}(1-\tfrac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8})^{T-t}\left(\frac{16L\tilde{\eta}G^{2}}{S}+288L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}\tilde{G}^{2}\right)\,.

Output ğ’™out=ğ’™Ï„superscriptğ’™outsuperscriptğ’™ğœ\bm{x}^{\text{out}}=\bm{x}^{\tau} where Ï„ğœ\tau is chosen with probability proportional to (1âˆ’Î¼â€‹Î·~8)Tâˆ’tsuperscript1ğœ‡~ğœ‚8ğ‘‡ğ‘¡(1-\tfrac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8})^{T-t}. Then, this yields with appropriate step-size Î·~~ğœ‚\tilde{\eta} yields the final rate (see LemmaÂ 1 of [30]).

ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’™out)âˆ¥2â‰¤ğ’ª~(Ïƒ2Î¼â€‹T+L2â€‹G~2Î¼2â€‹T2+L(f(ğ’™0)âˆ’fâ‹†)exp(âˆ’Î¼â€‹T12â€‹Bâ€‹L)).\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{\text{out}})\rVert^{2}\leq\tilde{\mathcal{O}}\left(\frac{\sigma^{2}}{\mu T}+\frac{L^{2}\tilde{G}^{2}}{\mu^{2}T^{2}}+L(f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star})\exp\left(-\frac{\mu T}{12BL}\right)\right)\,.

F.3 Convergence of MimeAdam and MimeLiteAdam (CorollaryÂ III)

We will largely follow the convergence analysis of [70] for the analysis of Adam. A crucial difference between their setting and ours is that in our algorithm we use the global statistics (second order moment) corresponding to tâˆ’1ğ‘¡1t-1 i.e. ğ’—tâˆ’1superscriptğ’—ğ‘¡1\sqrt{\bm{v}^{t-1}} instead of ğ’—tsuperscriptğ’—ğ‘¡\sqrt{\bm{v}^{t}} where the â‹…â‹…\sqrt{\cdot} operator is applied element wise. Practically, this does not make a significant difference since the discount (momentum) factor for the second momentum is very large. Theoretically however, this difference simplifies our proof significantly removing otherwise hard to handle stochastic dependencies.

In this section, we will use Adam as our base optimizer with Îµ0>0subscriptğœ€00\varepsilon_{0}>0 parameter for stability and Î²1=0subscriptğ›½10\beta_{1}=0 (i.e. RMSProp). This is identical to the setting in the centralized algorithm analyzed by [70]. The properties of our base optimizer are then:

  • â€¢

    ğ’”t=ğ’—tsuperscriptğ’”ğ‘¡superscriptğ’—ğ‘¡\bm{s}^{t}=\bm{v}^{t} which is a running average estimate of the second moment and satisfies ğ’—t>0superscriptğ’—ğ‘¡0\bm{v}^{t}>0.

  • â€¢

    ğ’°â€‹(ğ’ˆ;ğ’—tâˆ’1)=ğ’ˆğ’—tâˆ’1+Îµ0ğ’°ğ’ˆsuperscriptğ’—ğ‘¡1ğ’ˆsuperscriptğ’—ğ‘¡1subscriptğœ€0\mathcal{U}(\bm{g};\bm{v}^{t-1})=\frac{\bm{g}}{\sqrt{\bm{v}^{t-1}}+\varepsilon_{0}} for any ğ’ˆğ’ˆ\bm{g}. This update for any ğ’—tâˆ’1superscriptğ’—ğ‘¡1\bm{v}^{t-1} is BğµB-Lipschitz for B=1Îµ0ğµ1subscriptğœ€0B=\frac{1}{\varepsilon_{0}}.

In this sub-section, all operations on vectors (multiplication, division, addition, comparison) are applied element-wise with appropriate broad-casting.

One round progress of Adam.
Lemma 13 (Effective step-sizes).

Suppose that |âˆ‡jfiâ€‹(ğ±)|â‰¤Hsubscriptâˆ‡ğ‘—subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–ğ±ğ»|\nabla_{j}f_{i}(\bm{x})|\leq H. Then Adam has effective step-sizes

1H+Îµ0â€‹ğ’ˆâ‰¤ğ’°â€‹(ğ’ˆ;ğ’—tâˆ’1)â‰¤1Îµ0â€‹ğ’ˆ.1ğ»subscriptğœ€0ğ’ˆğ’°ğ’ˆsuperscriptğ’—ğ‘¡11subscriptğœ€0ğ’ˆ\frac{1}{H+\varepsilon_{0}}\bm{g}\leq\mathcal{U}(\bm{g};\bm{v}^{t-1})\leq\frac{1}{\varepsilon_{0}}\bm{g}\,.
Proof.

Recall that ğ’—t=Î²2â€‹ğ’—tâˆ’1+(1âˆ’Î²2)â€‹(ğ’„t)2superscriptğ’—ğ‘¡subscriptğ›½2superscriptğ’—ğ‘¡11subscriptğ›½2superscriptsuperscriptğ’„ğ‘¡2\bm{v}^{t}=\beta_{2}\bm{v}^{t-1}+(1-\beta_{2})(\bm{c}^{t})^{2} starting from ğ’—0=0superscriptğ’—00\bm{v}^{0}=0. Thus for any tâ‰¥0ğ‘¡0t\geq 0, we have ğ’—tâ‰¥0superscriptğ’—ğ‘¡0\bm{v}^{t}\geq 0 and hence ğ’—tâˆ’1+Îµ0â‰¥Îµ0superscriptğ’—ğ‘¡1subscriptğœ€0subscriptğœ€0\sqrt{\bm{v}^{t-1}}+\varepsilon_{0}\geq\varepsilon_{0}. For the other side, recall that ğ’—tsuperscriptğ’—ğ‘¡\bm{v}^{t} is updated with centralized stochastic gradients ğ’„t=1Sâ€‹âˆ‘iâˆ‡fiâ€‹(ğ’™)superscriptğ’„ğ‘¡1ğ‘†subscriptğ‘–âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–ğ’™\bm{c}^{t}=\frac{1}{S}\sum_{i}\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x}).

[ğ’„t]j=1Sâ€‹âˆ‘i[âˆ‡fiâ€‹(ğ’™)]jâ‰¤H.subscriptdelimited-[]superscriptğ’„ğ‘¡ğ‘—1ğ‘†subscriptğ‘–subscriptdelimited-[]âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–ğ’™ğ‘—ğ»[\bm{c}^{t}]_{j}=\frac{1}{S}\sum_{i}\left[\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x})\right]_{j}\leq H\,.

Further,

[ğ’—t]j=Î²2â€‹[ğ’—tâˆ’1]j+(1âˆ’Î²2)â€‹[ğ’„t]j2â‰¤Î²2â€‹[ğ’—tâˆ’1]j+(1âˆ’Î²2)â€‹H2â‰¤H2.subscriptdelimited-[]superscriptğ’—ğ‘¡ğ‘—subscriptğ›½2subscriptdelimited-[]superscriptğ’—ğ‘¡1ğ‘—1subscriptğ›½2superscriptsubscriptdelimited-[]superscriptğ’„ğ‘¡ğ‘—2subscriptğ›½2subscriptdelimited-[]superscriptğ’—ğ‘¡1ğ‘—1subscriptğ›½2superscriptğ»2superscriptğ»2[\bm{v}^{t}]_{j}=\beta_{2}[\bm{v}^{t-1}]_{j}+(1-\beta_{2})[\bm{c}^{t}]_{j}^{2}\leq\beta_{2}[\bm{v}^{t-1}]_{j}+(1-\beta_{2})H^{2}\leq H^{2}\,.

Hence ğ’—tâˆ’1+Îµ0â‰¤H+Îµ0superscriptğ’—ğ‘¡1subscriptğœ€0ğ»subscriptğœ€0\sqrt{\bm{v}^{t-1}+\varepsilon_{0}}\leq H+\varepsilon_{0}. âˆ

Lemma 14 (One round progress).

For one round of Adam with error ğtsuperscriptğğ‘¡\bm{e}^{t} in the update ğ’°ğ’°\mathcal{U} and using ğœtsuperscriptğœğ‘¡\bm{c}^{t} for update ğ’±ğ’±\mathcal{V}, we have

ğ”¼f(ğ’™t)â‰¤ğ”¼f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ’Î·~4â€‹(H+Îµ0)âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2+Î·~â€‹((H+Îµ0)+Îµ0/(H+Îµ0))2â€‹Îµ02ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ¥2+Lâ€‹Î·~2â€‹G2Sâ€‹Îµ02.\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t})\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{4(H+\varepsilon_{0})}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\frac{\tilde{\eta}\left((H+\varepsilon_{0})+\varepsilon_{0}/(H+\varepsilon_{0})\right)}{2\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}+\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}}{S\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}\,.
Proof.

Starting from LemmaÂ 13 and the smoothness of fğ‘“f, we have

ğ”¼â¡fâ€‹(ğ’™t)ğ”¼ğ‘“superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡\displaystyle\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t}) â‰¤ğ”¼f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ’Î·~ğ”¼âŸ¨âˆ‡f(ğ’™tâˆ’1),ğ”¼t[ğ’°(ğ’„t+ğ’†t)]âŸ©+Lâ€‹Î·~22ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’°(ğ’„t+ğ’†t;ğ’—tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\tilde{\eta}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\langle\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1}),\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}_{t}[\mathcal{U}\left(\bm{c}^{t}+\bm{e}^{t}\right)]\rangle+\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}}{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\mathcal{U}\left(\bm{c}^{t}+\bm{e}^{t};\bm{v}^{t-1}\right)\rVert^{2}
â‰¤ğ”¼f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ’Î·~ğ”¼âŸ¨âˆ‡f(ğ’™tâˆ’1),ğ”¼t[ğ’„t+ğ’†tğ’—tâˆ’1+Îµ0]âŸ©+Lâ€‹Î·~22ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’°(ğ’„t+ğ’†t;ğ’—tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\tilde{\eta}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\langle\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1}),\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}_{t}\left[\frac{\bm{c}^{t}+\bm{e}^{t}}{\sqrt{\bm{v}^{t-1}}+\varepsilon_{0}}\right]\rangle+\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}}{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\mathcal{U}\left(\bm{c}^{t}+\bm{e}^{t};\bm{v}^{t-1}\right)\rVert^{2}
â‰¤ğ”¼f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ’Î·~ğ”¼âŸ¨âˆ‡f(ğ’™tâˆ’1),[âˆ‡fâ€‹(ğ’™tâˆ’1)+ğ’†tğ’—tâˆ’1+Îµ0]âŸ©+Lâ€‹Î·~22â€‹Îµ02ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’„t+ğ’†tâˆ¥2\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\tilde{\eta}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\langle\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1}),\left[\frac{\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})+\bm{e}^{t}}{\sqrt{\bm{v}^{t-1}}+\varepsilon_{0}}\right]\rangle+\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}}{2\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{c}^{t}+\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}
â‰¤ğ”¼f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ’Î·~H+Îµ0âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2âˆ’Î·~ğ”¼âŸ¨âˆ‡f(ğ’™tâˆ’1),ğ’†tğ’—tâˆ’1+Îµ0âŸ©+Lâ€‹Î·~22â€‹Îµ02ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’„t+ğ’†tâˆ¥2\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{H+\varepsilon_{0}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}-\tilde{\eta}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\langle\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1}),\frac{\bm{e}^{t}}{\sqrt{\bm{v}^{t-1}}+\varepsilon_{0}}\rangle+\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}}{2\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{c}^{t}+\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}
â‰¤ğ”¼f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ’Î·~2â€‹(H+Îµ0)âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2+Î·~â€‹(H+Îµ0)2ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tğ’—tâˆ’1+Îµ0âˆ¥2+Lâ€‹Î·~22â€‹Îµ02ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’„t+ğ’†tâˆ¥2\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{2(H+\varepsilon_{0})}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\frac{\tilde{\eta}(H+\varepsilon_{0})}{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\frac{\bm{e}^{t}}{\sqrt{\bm{v}^{t-1}}+\varepsilon_{0}}\rVert^{2}+\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}}{2\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{c}^{t}+\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}
â‰¤ğ”¼f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ’(Î·~2â€‹(H+Îµ0)âˆ’Lâ€‹Î·~2Îµ02)âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2+Î·~â€‹(H+Îµ0)+2â€‹Lâ€‹Î·~22â€‹Îµ02ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ¥2+Lâ€‹Î·~2â€‹G2Sâ€‹Îµ02\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\left(\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{2(H+\varepsilon_{0})}-\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}}{\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}\right)\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\frac{\tilde{\eta}(H+\varepsilon_{0})+2L\tilde{\eta}^{2}}{2\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}+\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}}{S\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}
â‰¤ğ”¼f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ’Î·~4â€‹(H+Îµ0)âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2+Î·~â€‹((H+Îµ0)+Îµ0/(H+Îµ0))2â€‹Îµ02ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ¥2+Lâ€‹Î·~2â€‹G2Sâ€‹Îµ02\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{4(H+\varepsilon_{0})}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\frac{\tilde{\eta}\left((H+\varepsilon_{0})+\varepsilon_{0}/(H+\varepsilon_{0})\right)}{2\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}+\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}}{S\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}

Here we used our bound on the step-size that Î·~â‰¤Îµ04â€‹Lâ€‹(H+Îµ0)~ğœ‚subscriptğœ€04ğ¿ğ»subscriptğœ€0\tilde{\eta}\leq\frac{\varepsilon_{0}}{4L(H+\varepsilon_{0})}. âˆ

Convergence of MimeAdam.
Lemma 15.

Suppose that assumptionsÂ (A1)â€“((A3)) hold and further |âˆ‡jfiâ€‹(ğ±)|â‰¤Hsubscriptâˆ‡ğ‘—subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–ğ±ğ»|\nabla_{j}f_{i}(\bm{x})|\leq H. Then, running MimeAdam with step-size Î·~â‰¤Îµ0212â€‹Lâ€‹(H+Îµ0)~ğœ‚superscriptsubscriptğœ€0212ğ¿ğ»subscriptğœ€0\tilde{\eta}\leq\frac{\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}{12L(H+\varepsilon_{0})}, we have

1Tâˆ‘t=1Tğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2â‰¤96â€‹Lâ€‹(H+Îµ0)2â€‹(fâ€‹(ğ’™0)âˆ’fâ‹†)Îµ02â€‹T+2â€‹G2S.\frac{1}{T}\sum_{t=1}^{T}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}\leq\frac{96L(H+\varepsilon_{0})^{2}(f(\bm{x}_{0})-f^{\star})}{\varepsilon_{0}^{2}T}+\frac{2G^{2}}{S}\,.

Combining LemmaÂ 14 with the bound on ğ’†tsuperscriptğ’†ğ‘¡\bm{e}^{t} from LemmaÂ 9 we get,

ğ”¼â¡fâ€‹(ğ’™t)ğ”¼ğ‘“superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡\displaystyle\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t}) â‰¤ğ”¼f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ’Î·~4â€‹(H+Îµ0)âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2+Î·~â€‹((H+Îµ0)+Îµ0/(H+Îµ0))2â€‹Îµ02ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ¥2+Lâ€‹Î·~2â€‹G2Sâ€‹Îµ02\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{4(H+\varepsilon_{0})}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\frac{\tilde{\eta}\left((H+\varepsilon_{0})+\varepsilon_{0}/(H+\varepsilon_{0})\right)}{2\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}+\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}}{S\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}
â‰¤ğ”¼f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ’Î·~4â€‹(H+Îµ0)âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2+9â€‹L2â€‹Î·~3â€‹((H+Îµ0)+Îµ0/(H+Îµ0))Îµ04ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’„tâˆ¥2\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{4(H+\varepsilon_{0})}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\frac{9L^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{3}\left((H+\varepsilon_{0})+\varepsilon_{0}/(H+\varepsilon_{0})\right)}{\varepsilon_{0}^{4}}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{c}^{t}\rVert^{2}
+Lâ€‹Î·~2â€‹G2Sâ€‹Îµ02ğ¿superscript~ğœ‚2superscriptğº2ğ‘†superscriptsubscriptğœ€02\displaystyle\hskip 56.9055pt+\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}}{S\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}
â‰¤ğ”¼â¡fâ€‹(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ’(Î·~4â€‹(H+Îµ0)âˆ’9â€‹L2â€‹Î·~3â€‹((H+Îµ0)+Îµ0/(H+Îµ0))Îµ04)â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡fâ€‹(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2absentğ”¼ğ‘“superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡1~ğœ‚4ğ»subscriptğœ€09superscriptğ¿2superscript~ğœ‚3ğ»subscriptğœ€0subscriptğœ€0ğ»subscriptğœ€0superscriptsubscriptğœ€04superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥âˆ‡ğ‘“superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡12\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\left(\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{4(H+\varepsilon_{0})}-\frac{9L^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{3}\left((H+\varepsilon_{0})+\varepsilon_{0}/(H+\varepsilon_{0})\right)}{\varepsilon_{0}^{4}}\right)\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}
+Lâ€‹Î·~2â€‹G2Sâ€‹Îµ02+9â€‹L2â€‹Î·~3â€‹((H+Îµ0)+Îµ0/(H+Îµ0))â€‹G2Sâ€‹Îµ04ğ¿superscript~ğœ‚2superscriptğº2ğ‘†superscriptsubscriptğœ€029superscriptğ¿2superscript~ğœ‚3ğ»subscriptğœ€0subscriptğœ€0ğ»subscriptğœ€0superscriptğº2ğ‘†superscriptsubscriptğœ€04\displaystyle\hskip 56.9055pt+\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}}{S\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}+\frac{9L^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{3}\left((H+\varepsilon_{0})+\varepsilon_{0}/(H+\varepsilon_{0})\right)G^{2}}{S\varepsilon_{0}^{4}}
â‰¤ğ”¼â¡fâ€‹(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ’(Î·~4â€‹(H+Îµ0)âˆ’18â€‹L2â€‹Î·~3â€‹(H+Îµ0)Îµ04)â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡fâ€‹(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2absentğ”¼ğ‘“superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡1~ğœ‚4ğ»subscriptğœ€018superscriptğ¿2superscript~ğœ‚3ğ»subscriptğœ€0superscriptsubscriptğœ€04superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥âˆ‡ğ‘“superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡12\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\left(\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{4(H+\varepsilon_{0})}-\frac{18L^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{3}(H+\varepsilon_{0})}{\varepsilon_{0}^{4}}\right)\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}
+Lâ€‹Î·~2â€‹G2Sâ€‹Îµ02+18â€‹L2â€‹Î·~3â€‹(H+Îµ0)â€‹G2Sâ€‹Îµ04ğ¿superscript~ğœ‚2superscriptğº2ğ‘†superscriptsubscriptğœ€0218superscriptğ¿2superscript~ğœ‚3ğ»subscriptğœ€0superscriptğº2ğ‘†superscriptsubscriptğœ€04\displaystyle\hskip 56.9055pt+\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}}{S\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}+\frac{18L^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{3}(H+\varepsilon_{0})G^{2}}{S\varepsilon_{0}^{4}}
â‰¤ğ”¼â¡fâ€‹(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ’Î·~8â€‹(H+Îµ0)â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡fâ€‹(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2+Î·~â€‹G24â€‹Sâ€‹(H+Îµ0).absentğ”¼ğ‘“superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡1~ğœ‚8ğ»subscriptğœ€0superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥âˆ‡ğ‘“superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡12~ğœ‚superscriptğº24ğ‘†ğ»subscriptğœ€0\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{8(H+\varepsilon_{0})}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\frac{\tilde{\eta}G^{2}}{4S(H+\varepsilon_{0})}\,.

To simplify computations, here we assumed we assumed (H+Îµ0)2â‰¥Îµ0superscriptğ»subscriptğœ€02subscriptğœ€0(H+\varepsilon_{0})^{2}\geq\varepsilon_{0} without loss of generality. If this is not true, we can replace Hğ»H by maxâ¡(H,Îµ0âˆ’Îµ0)ğ»subscriptğœ€0subscriptğœ€0\max(H,\sqrt{\varepsilon_{0}}-\varepsilon_{0}). Assuming Î·~â‰¤Îµ0212â€‹Lâ€‹(H+Îµ0)~ğœ‚superscriptsubscriptğœ€0212ğ¿ğ»subscriptğœ€0\tilde{\eta}\leq\frac{\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}{12L(H+\varepsilon_{0})}, we have 18â€‹L2â€‹Î·~2â€‹(H+Îµ0)Îµ04â‰¤18â€‹(H+Îµ0)18superscriptğ¿2superscript~ğœ‚2ğ»subscriptğœ€0superscriptsubscriptğœ€0418ğ»subscriptğœ€0\frac{18L^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}(H+\varepsilon_{0})}{\varepsilon_{0}^{4}}\leq\frac{1}{8(H+\varepsilon_{0})}. Rearranging the terms and substituting the bounds on the step-size yields the lemma.

Convergence of MimeLiteAdam.
Lemma 16.

Suppose that assumptionsÂ (A1)â€“((A3)) hold and further |âˆ‡jfiâ€‹(ğ±)|â‰¤Hsubscriptâˆ‡ğ‘—subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–ğ±ğ»|\nabla_{j}f_{i}(\bm{x})|\leq H. Then, running MimeLiteAdam with step-size Î·~â‰¤Îµ0212â€‹Lâ€‹Sâ€‹(H+Îµ0)~ğœ‚superscriptsubscriptğœ€0212ğ¿ğ‘†ğ»subscriptğœ€0\tilde{\eta}\leq\frac{\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}{12L\sqrt{S}(H+\varepsilon_{0})}, we have for G~2:=G2+Ïƒ2/Kassignsuperscript~ğº2superscriptğº2superscriptğœ2ğ¾\tilde{G}^{2}:=G^{2}+\sigma^{2}/K,

1Tâˆ‘t=1Tğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2â‰¤96â€‹Lâ€‹Sâ€‹(H+Îµ0)2â€‹(fâ€‹(ğ’™0)âˆ’fâ‹†)Îµ02â€‹T+2â€‹G~2S.\frac{1}{T}\sum_{t=1}^{T}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}\leq\frac{96L\sqrt{S}(H+\varepsilon_{0})^{2}(f(\bm{x}_{0})-f^{\star})}{\varepsilon_{0}^{2}T}+\frac{2\tilde{G}^{2}}{S}\,.

Combining LemmaÂ 14 with the bound on ğ’†tsuperscriptğ’†ğ‘¡\bm{e}^{t} from LemmaÂ 9 we get for G~2:=G2+Ïƒ2/Kassignsuperscript~ğº2superscriptğº2superscriptğœ2ğ¾\tilde{G}^{2}:=G^{2}+\sigma^{2}/K,

ğ”¼â¡fâ€‹(ğ’™t)ğ”¼ğ‘“superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡\displaystyle\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t}) â‰¤ğ”¼f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ’Î·~4â€‹(H+Îµ0)âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2+Î·~â€‹(H+Îµ0)Îµ02ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ¥2+Lâ€‹Î·~2â€‹G2Sâ€‹Îµ02\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{4(H+\varepsilon_{0})}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\frac{\tilde{\eta}(H+\varepsilon_{0})}{\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}+\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}}{S\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}
â‰¤ğ”¼â¡fâ€‹(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ’Î·~4â€‹(H+Îµ0)â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡fâ€‹(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2absentğ”¼ğ‘“superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡1~ğœ‚4ğ»subscriptğœ€0superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥âˆ‡ğ‘“superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡12\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{4(H+\varepsilon_{0})}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}
+18â€‹L2â€‹Î·~3â€‹(H+Îµ0)Îµ04ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2+18â€‹L2â€‹Î·~3â€‹(H+Îµ0)â€‹(G~2)Îµ04+Lâ€‹Î·~2â€‹G2Sâ€‹Îµ02\displaystyle\hskip 56.9055pt+\frac{18L^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{3}(H+\varepsilon_{0})}{\varepsilon_{0}^{4}}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\frac{18L^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{3}(H+\varepsilon_{0})(\tilde{G}^{2})}{\varepsilon_{0}^{4}}+\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}}{S\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}
â‰¤ğ”¼â¡fâ€‹(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ’Î·~8â€‹(H+Îµ0)â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡fâ€‹(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2+Î·~â€‹G~24â€‹Sâ€‹(H+Îµ0)absentğ”¼ğ‘“superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡1~ğœ‚8ğ»subscriptğœ€0superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥âˆ‡ğ‘“superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡12~ğœ‚superscript~ğº24ğ‘†ğ»subscriptğœ€0\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{8(H+\varepsilon_{0})}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\frac{\tilde{\eta}\tilde{G}^{2}}{4S(H+\varepsilon_{0})}

Again as before to simplify computations, here we assumed (H+Îµ0)2â‰¥Îµ0superscriptğ»subscriptğœ€02subscriptğœ€0(H+\varepsilon_{0})^{2}\geq\varepsilon_{0} without loss of generality. If this is not true, we can replace Hğ»H by maxâ¡(H,Îµ0âˆ’Îµ0)ğ»subscriptğœ€0subscriptğœ€0\max(H,\sqrt{\varepsilon_{0}}-\varepsilon_{0}). Assuming Î·~â‰¤Îµ0212â€‹Lâ€‹(H+Îµ0)â€‹S~ğœ‚superscriptsubscriptğœ€0212ğ¿ğ»subscriptğœ€0ğ‘†\tilde{\eta}\leq\frac{\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}{12L(H+\varepsilon_{0})\sqrt{S}}, we have 18â€‹L2â€‹Î·~2â€‹(H+Îµ0)Îµ04â‰¤18â€‹Sâ€‹(H+Îµ0)18superscriptğ¿2superscript~ğœ‚2ğ»subscriptğœ€0superscriptsubscriptğœ€0418ğ‘†ğ»subscriptğœ€0\frac{18L^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}(H+\varepsilon_{0})}{\varepsilon_{0}^{4}}\leq\frac{1}{8S(H+\varepsilon_{0})}. Rearranging the terms and substituting the bounds on the step-size yields the lemma.

Appendix G Circumventing server-only lower bounds

In this section we see how to use momentum based variance reduction [14, 57] to reduce the variance of the updates and improve convergence. It should be noted that MVR does not exactly fit the Mime framework (BaseAlg) since it requires computing gradients at two points on the same batch. However, it is straightforward to extend the idea of Mime to MVR as we will now do. We use MVR as a theoretical justification for why the usual momentum works well in practice. An interesting future direction would be to adapt the algorithm and analysis of [13], which does fit the framework of Mime.

For the sake of convenience, we summarize the notation used in the proof in a table.

G.1 Algorithm descriptions

Now, we formally describe the Mime MVR and MimeLite MVR algorithms. In each round tğ‘¡t, we sample clients ğ’®tsuperscriptğ’®ğ‘¡\mathcal{S}^{t} such that |ğ’®t|=Ssuperscriptğ’®ğ‘¡ğ‘†\lvert\mathcal{S}^{t}\rvert=S. The server communicates the server parameters ğ’™tâˆ’1superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡1\bm{x}^{t-1}, the past parameters ğ’™tâˆ’2superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡2\bm{x}^{t-2}, and the momentum ğ’tâˆ’1superscriptğ’ğ‘¡1\bm{m}^{t-1} term. Mime additionally uses a control variate ğ’„tâˆ’1superscriptğ’„ğ‘¡1\bm{c}^{t-1} as we describe next.

Control variate in Mime.

Mime uses an additional control variate ğ’„tâˆ’1superscriptğ’„ğ‘¡1\bm{c}^{t-1} to reduce the variance.

ğ’„tâˆ’1=1Sâ€‹âˆ‘iâˆˆğ’®tâˆ‡fiâ€‹(ğ’™tâˆ’2).superscriptğ’„ğ‘¡11ğ‘†subscriptğ‘–superscriptğ’®ğ‘¡âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡2\bm{c}^{t-1}=\frac{1}{S}\sum_{i\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x}^{t-2})\,. (12)

Note that both ğ’„tâˆ’1superscriptğ’„ğ‘¡1\bm{c}^{t-1} and ğ’tâˆ’1superscriptğ’ğ‘¡1\bm{m}^{t-1} use gradients and parameters from previous rounds (different from the previous section). A naive implementation of this method requires two steps of communication per round to implement this algorithm. Alternatively, we can reserve some clients in the previous round for computing ğ’„tâˆ’1superscriptğ’„ğ‘¡1\bm{c}^{t-1} which can then be used in the current round, removing the need for two steps of communication. In particular, it can be computed on a different set of an independent sampled clients ğ’®~tâˆ’1superscript~ğ’®ğ‘¡1\tilde{\mathcal{S}}^{t-1}. In fact, all our theoretical results hold even if we use a single client to perform the local updates and the rest of clients are used only to compute ğ’„tâˆ’1superscriptğ’„ğ‘¡1\bm{c}^{t-1} each round.

Local client updates.

Then each client iâˆˆğ’®tğ‘–superscriptğ’®ğ‘¡i\in\mathcal{S}^{t} makes a copy ğ’ši,0t=ğ’™tâˆ’1superscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘–0ğ‘¡superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡1\bm{y}_{i,0}^{t}=\bm{x}^{t-1} and perform Kğ¾K local client updates. In each local client update kâˆˆ[K]ğ‘˜delimited-[]ğ¾k\in[K], the client samples a dataset Î¶i,ktsuperscriptsubscriptğœğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡\zeta_{i,k}^{t}. Mime performs the following update:

ğ’ši,kt=ğ’ši,kâˆ’1tâˆ’Î·â€‹ğ’…i,kt,Â whereÂ ğ’…i,kt=aâ€‹(âˆ‡fiâ€‹(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t;Î¶i,kt)âˆ’âˆ‡fiâ€‹(ğ’™tâˆ’1;Î¶i,kt)+ğ’„tâˆ’1)+(1âˆ’a)â€‹ğ’tâˆ’1+(1âˆ’a)â€‹(âˆ‡fiâ€‹(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t;Î¶i,kt)âˆ’âˆ‡fiâ€‹(ğ’™tâˆ’1;Î¶i,kt)).formulae-sequencesuperscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘–ğ‘˜1ğ‘¡ğœ‚superscriptsubscriptğ’…ğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡Â whereÂ superscriptsubscriptğ’…ğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡ğ‘âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘–ğ‘˜1ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğœğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡1superscriptsubscriptğœğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡superscriptğ’„ğ‘¡11ğ‘superscriptğ’ğ‘¡11ğ‘âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘–ğ‘˜1ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğœğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡1superscriptsubscriptğœğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡\begin{split}\bm{y}_{i,k}^{t}&=\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t}-\eta\bm{d}_{i,k}^{t}\,,\text{ where }\\ \bm{d}_{i,k}^{t}&=a(\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t};\zeta_{i,k}^{t})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x}^{t-1};\zeta_{i,k}^{t})+\bm{c}^{t-1})+(1-a)\bm{m}^{t-1}\\ &\hskip 56.9055pt+(1-a)(\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t};\zeta_{i,k}^{t})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x}^{t-1};\zeta_{i,k}^{t}))\,.\end{split} (13)

MimeLite on the other hand uses a very similar but simpler update scheme which does not rely on ğ’„tâˆ’1superscriptğ’„ğ‘¡1\bm{c}^{t-1}:

ğ’ši,kt=ğ’ši,kâˆ’1tâˆ’Î·â€‹ğ’…i,kt,Â whereÂ ğ’…i,kt=aâ€‹âˆ‡fiâ€‹(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t;Î¶i,kt)+(1âˆ’a)â€‹ğ’tâˆ’1+(1âˆ’a)â€‹(âˆ‡fiâ€‹(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t;Î¶i,kt)âˆ’âˆ‡fiâ€‹(ğ’™tâˆ’1;Î¶i,kt)).formulae-sequencesuperscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘–ğ‘˜1ğ‘¡ğœ‚superscriptsubscriptğ’…ğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡Â whereÂ superscriptsubscriptğ’…ğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡ğ‘âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘–ğ‘˜1ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğœğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡1ğ‘superscriptğ’ğ‘¡11ğ‘âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘–ğ‘˜1ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğœğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡1superscriptsubscriptğœğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡\begin{split}\bm{y}_{i,k}^{t}&=\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t}-\eta\bm{d}_{i,k}^{t}\,,\text{ where }\\ \bm{d}_{i,k}^{t}&=a\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t};\zeta_{i,k}^{t})+(1-a)\bm{m}^{t-1}\\ &\hskip 56.9055pt+(1-a)(\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t};\zeta_{i,k}^{t})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x}^{t-1};\zeta_{i,k}^{t}))\,.\end{split} (14)
Server updates.

After Kğ¾K such local updates, the server then aggregates the new client parameters as

ğ’™t=1Sâ€‹âˆ‘jâˆˆğ’®tğ’šj,Kt.superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡1ğ‘†subscriptğ‘—superscriptğ’®ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘—ğ¾ğ‘¡\bm{x}^{t}=\frac{1}{S}\sum_{j\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}\bm{y}_{j,K}^{t}\,. (15)

The momentum term is updated at the end of the round for aâ‰¥0ğ‘0a\geq 0 as

ğ’t=aâ€‹(1Sâ€‹âˆ‘jâˆˆğ’®tâˆ‡fjâ€‹(ğ’™tâˆ’1))+(1âˆ’a)â€‹ğ’tâˆ’1âŸSGDm+(1âˆ’a)â€‹(1Sâ€‹âˆ‘jâˆˆğ’®tâˆ‡fjâ€‹(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ’âˆ‡fjâ€‹(ğ’™tâˆ’2))âŸcorrection.superscriptğ’ğ‘¡subscriptâŸğ‘1ğ‘†subscriptğ‘—superscriptğ’®ğ‘¡âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘—superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡11ğ‘superscriptğ’ğ‘¡1SGDmsubscriptâŸ1ğ‘1ğ‘†subscriptğ‘—superscriptğ’®ğ‘¡âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘—superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡1âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘—superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡2correction\bm{m}^{t}=\underbrace{a(\tfrac{1}{S}\textstyle\sum_{j\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}\nabla f_{j}(\bm{x}^{t-1}))+(1-a)\bm{m}^{t-1}}_{\text{SGDm}}+\underbrace{(1-a)(\tfrac{1}{S}\textstyle\sum_{j\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}\nabla f_{j}(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\nabla f_{j}(\bm{x}^{t-2}))}_{\text{correction}}\,. (16)

As we can see, the momentum update of MVR can be broken down into the usual SGDm update, and a correction. Intuitively, this correction term is very small since fisubscriptğ‘“ğ‘–f_{i} is smooth and ğ’™tâˆ’1â‰ˆğ’™tâˆ’2superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡1superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡2\bm{x}^{t-1}\approx\bm{x}^{t-2}. Another way of looking at the update (16) is to note that if all functions are identical i.e. fj=fksubscriptğ‘“ğ‘—subscriptğ‘“ğ‘˜f_{j}=f_{k} for any j,kğ‘—ğ‘˜j,k, then (16) just becomes the usual gradient descent. Thus MimeMVR tries to maintain an exponential moving average of only the variance terms, reducing its bias. We refer to [14] for more detailed explanation of MVR.

G.2 Bias in updates

The main difference in MimeMVR from the centralized versions of [57, 14] is the additional local steps which are biased. In particular, for kâ‰¥1ğ‘˜1k\geq 1 the expected gradient ğ”¼â¡[âˆ‡fiâ€‹(ğ’ši,kt)]â‰ âˆ‡fâ€‹(ğ’ši,kt)ğ”¼âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡âˆ‡ğ‘“superscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}[\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k}^{t})]\neq\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k}^{t}) because ğ’ši,ktsuperscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡\bm{y}_{i,k}^{t} also depends on the sample iğ‘–i. This bias is in fact the underlying cause of client drift and controlling it is a crucial step for our analysis.

Lemma 17 (Mime bias).

For any values of ğ±ğ±\bm{x} and ğ²isubscriptğ²ğ‘–\bm{y}_{i} where ğ²isubscriptğ²ğ‘–\bm{y}_{i} may depend on iğ‘–i, the following holds for any client iğ‘–i almost surely given that ((A1)) and ((A2)) hold:

ğ”¼ğ’®,Î¶âˆ¥âˆ‡fi(ğ’ši;Î¶)+1|ğ’®|âˆ‘jâˆˆğ’®âˆ‡fj(ğ’™)âˆ’âˆ‡fi(ğ’™;Î¶)âˆ’âˆ‡f(ğ’ši)âˆ¥2â‰¤2Î´2ğ”¼ğ’®âˆ¥ğ’šiâˆ’ğ’™âˆ¥2+2â€‹G2S.\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}_{\mathcal{S},\zeta}\left\lVert\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i};\zeta)+\frac{1}{\lvert\mathcal{S}\rvert}\sum_{j\in\mathcal{S}}\nabla f_{j}(\bm{x})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x};\zeta)\quad-\quad\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i})\right\rVert^{2}\leq 2\delta^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}_{\mathcal{S}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}+\frac{2G^{2}}{S}\,.
Proof.

We can separate the noise from the rest of the terms and expand as

ğ”¼Î¶,ğ’®âˆ¥âˆ‡fi(ğ’ši;Î¶)+1|ğ’®|âˆ‘jâˆˆğ’®âˆ‡fj(ğ’™)âˆ’âˆ‡fi(ğ’™;Î¶)âˆ’âˆ‡f(ğ’ši)âˆ¥2\displaystyle\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}_{\zeta,\mathcal{S}}\left\lVert\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i};\zeta)+\frac{1}{\lvert\mathcal{S}\rvert}\sum_{j\in\mathcal{S}}\nabla f_{j}(\bm{x})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x};\zeta)-\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i})\right\rVert^{2}
â‰¤2ğ”¼ğ’®âˆ¥âˆ‡fi(ğ’ši;Î¶)+âˆ‡f(ğ’™)âˆ’âˆ‡fi(ğ’™;Î¶)âˆ’âˆ‡f(ğ’ši)âˆ¥2+2ğ”¼ğ’®âˆ¥1|ğ’®|âˆ‘jâˆˆğ’®âˆ‡fj(ğ’™)âˆ’âˆ‡f(ğ’™)âˆ¥2\displaystyle\leq 2\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}_{\mathcal{S}}\left\lVert\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i};\zeta)+\nabla f(\bm{x})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x};\zeta)-\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i})\right\rVert^{2}+2\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}_{\mathcal{S}}\left\lVert\frac{1}{\lvert\mathcal{S}\rvert}\sum_{j\in\mathcal{S}}\nabla f_{j}(\bm{x})-\nabla f(\bm{x})\right\rVert^{2}
â‰¤2ğ”¼ğ’®âˆ¥âˆ‡fi(ğ’ši;Î¶)+âˆ‡f(ğ’™)âˆ’âˆ‡fi(ğ’™;Î¶)âˆ’âˆ‡f(ğ’ši)âˆ¥2+2â€‹G2S\displaystyle\leq 2\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}_{\mathcal{S}}\left\lVert\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i};\zeta)+\nabla f(\bm{x})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x};\zeta)-\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i})\right\rVert^{2}+\frac{2G^{2}}{S}
â‰¤2â€‹ğ”¼ğ’®â¡Î´2â€‹âˆ¥ğ’šiâˆ’ğ’™âˆ¥2+2â€‹G2S.absent2subscriptğ”¼ğ’®superscriptğ›¿2superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptğ’šğ‘–ğ’™22superscriptğº2ğ‘†\displaystyle\leq 2\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}_{\mathcal{S}}\delta^{2}\lVert\bm{y}_{i}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}+\frac{2G^{2}}{S}\,.

The first inequality used Youngâ€™s inequality, the second used ((A1)), and the last used ((A2)) in the form of LemmaÂ 3. âˆ

We can perform a similar analysis of the bias of local updates encountered by MimeLite.

Lemma 18 (MimeLite bias).

For any values of ğ±ğ±\bm{x} and ğ²isubscriptğ²ğ‘–\bm{y}_{i} where ğ²isubscriptğ²ğ‘–\bm{y}_{i} may depend on iğ‘–i, the following holds for any client iğ‘–i randomly chosen from ğ’Ÿğ’Ÿ\mathcal{D} given that ((A1)), ((A2)) and ((A3)) hold:

ğ”¼i,Î¶âˆ¥âˆ‡fi(ğ’ši;Î¶)âˆ’âˆ‡f(ğ’ši)âˆ¥2â‰¤2Î´2ğ”¼iâˆ¥ğ’šiâˆ’ğ’™âˆ¥2+2G2+Ïƒ2.\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}_{i,\zeta}\left\lVert\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i};\zeta)\quad-\quad\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i})\right\rVert^{2}\leq 2\delta^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}_{i}\lVert\bm{y}_{i}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}+2G^{2}+\sigma^{2}\,.
Proof.

We can separate the noise from the rest of the terms and expand as

ğ”¼Î¶,iâˆ¥âˆ‡fi(ğ’ši;Î¶)âˆ’âˆ‡f(ğ’ši)âˆ¥2\displaystyle\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}_{\zeta,i}\left\lVert\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i};\zeta)-\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i})\right\rVert^{2} =ğ”¼Î¶,iâˆ¥âˆ‡fi(ğ’ši;Î¶)Â±âˆ‡fi(ğ’™)Â±âˆ‡f(ğ’™)âˆ’âˆ‡f(ğ’ši)âˆ¥2\displaystyle=\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}_{\zeta,i}\left\lVert\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i};\zeta)\pm\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x})\pm\nabla f(\bm{x})-\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i})\right\rVert^{2}
â‰¤ğ”¼iâˆ¥âˆ‡fi(ğ’ši)Â±âˆ‡fi(ğ’™)Â±âˆ‡f(ğ’™)âˆ’âˆ‡f(ğ’ši)âˆ¥2+Ïƒ2\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}_{i}\left\lVert\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i})\pm\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x})\pm\nabla f(\bm{x})-\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i})\right\rVert^{2}+\sigma^{2}
â‰¤2ğ”¼iâˆ¥âˆ‡fi(ğ’ši)+âˆ‡f(ğ’™)âˆ’âˆ‡fi(ğ’™)âˆ’âˆ‡f(ğ’ši)âˆ¥2\displaystyle\leq 2\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}_{i}\left\lVert\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i})+\nabla f(\bm{x})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x})-\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i})\right\rVert^{2}
+2ğ”¼iâˆ¥âˆ‡fi(ğ’™)âˆ’âˆ‡f(ğ’™)âˆ¥2+Ïƒ2\displaystyle\hskip 56.9055pt+2\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}_{i}\left\lVert\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x})-\nabla f(\bm{x})\right\rVert^{2}+\sigma^{2}
â‰¤2ğ”¼iâˆ¥âˆ‡fi(ğ’ši)+âˆ‡f(ğ’™)âˆ’âˆ‡fi(ğ’™)âˆ’âˆ‡f(ğ’ši)âˆ¥2+2G2+Ïƒ2\displaystyle\leq 2\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}_{i}\left\lVert\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i})+\nabla f(\bm{x})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x})-\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i})\right\rVert^{2}+2G^{2}+\sigma^{2}
â‰¤2Î´2ğ”¼iâˆ¥ğ’šiâˆ’ğ’™âˆ¥2+2G2+Ïƒ2.\displaystyle\leq 2\delta^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}_{i}\lVert\bm{y}_{i}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}+2G^{2}+\sigma^{2}\,.

The first inequality used ((A3)), the second used Youngâ€™s inequality, the third used ((A1)), and the last used ((A2)) in the form of LemmaÂ 3. âˆ

Note that the bias for MimeLite is very similar to that of Mime, except that Mime has dependence of G2Ssuperscriptğº2ğ‘†\frac{G^{2}}{S}, whereas MimeLite has G2+Ïƒ2superscriptğº2superscriptğœ2G^{2}+\sigma^{2}. Hence, the rate of convergence of MimeLite will depend on G2superscriptğº2G^{2} wheras Mime will have the optimal dependency of G2/Ssuperscriptğº2ğ‘†G^{2}/S. Hence, in the rest of the proof, we will consider only Mime and simply replace G2/Ssuperscriptğº2ğ‘†G^{2}/S with (G2+Ïƒ2)superscriptğº2superscriptğœ2(G^{2}+\sigma^{2}) to obtain the corresponding results for MimeLite.

G.3 Change in each client update

Client update variance.

Now we examine the variance of our update in each local step ğ’…i,ktsuperscriptsubscriptğ’…ğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡\bm{d}_{i,k}^{t}.

Lemma 19.

For the client update (13), given ((A1)) and ((A2)), the following holds for any aâˆˆ[0,1]ğ‘01a\in[0,1] where ğt:=ğ¦tâˆ’âˆ‡fâ€‹(ğ±tâˆ’1)assignsuperscriptğğ‘¡superscriptğ¦ğ‘¡âˆ‡ğ‘“superscriptğ±ğ‘¡1\bm{e}^{t}:=\bm{m}^{t}-\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1}) and Î”i,kt:=ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ²i,ktâˆ’ğ±tâˆ’2âˆ¥2\Delta_{i,k}^{t}:=\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-2}\rVert^{2}:

ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’…i,ktâˆ’âˆ‡f(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)âˆ¥2â‰¤3ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ’1âˆ¥2+3Î´2Î”i,kâˆ’1t+3â€‹a2â€‹G2S.\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{d}_{i,k}^{t}-\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}\leq 3\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+3\delta^{2}\Delta_{i,k-1}^{t}+\frac{3a^{2}G^{2}}{S}\,.
Proof.

Starting from the client update (13), we can rewrite it as

ğ’…i,ktâˆ’âˆ‡fâ€‹(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)superscriptsubscriptğ’…ğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡âˆ‡ğ‘“superscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘–ğ‘˜1ğ‘¡\displaystyle\bm{d}_{i,k}^{t}-\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t}) =(1âˆ’a)â€‹ğ’†tâˆ’1absent1ğ‘superscriptğ’†ğ‘¡1\displaystyle=(1-a)\bm{e}^{t-1}
+(âˆ‡fi(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t;Î¶i,kt)âˆ’âˆ‡fi(ğ’™tâˆ’2;Î¶i,kt))âˆ’âˆ‡f(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)+âˆ‡f(ğ’™tâˆ’2))\displaystyle\hskip 14.22636pt+\left(\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t};\zeta_{i,k}^{t})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x}^{t-2};\zeta_{i,k}^{t}))-\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})+\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-2})\right)
+aâ€‹(1Sâ€‹âˆ‘jâˆˆğ’®tâˆ‡fjâ€‹(ğ’™tâˆ’2)âˆ’âˆ‡fâ€‹(ğ’™tâˆ’2)).ğ‘1ğ‘†subscriptğ‘—superscriptğ’®ğ‘¡âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘—superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡2âˆ‡ğ‘“superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡2\displaystyle\hskip 14.22636pt+a\left(\frac{1}{S}\sum_{j\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}\nabla f_{j}(\bm{x}^{t-2})-\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-2})\right)\,.

We can use the relaxed triangle inequality LemmaÂ 1 to claim

ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’…i,ktâˆ’âˆ‡f(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)âˆ¥2\displaystyle\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{d}_{i,k}^{t}-\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}
=3(1âˆ’a)2ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ’1âˆ¥2\displaystyle=3(1-a)^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}
+3â€‹(1âˆ’a)2â€‹âˆ¥(âˆ‡fiâ€‹(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t;Î¶i,kt)âˆ’âˆ‡fiâ€‹(ğ’™tâˆ’2;Î¶i,kt))âˆ’(âˆ‡fâ€‹(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)âˆ’âˆ‡fâ€‹(ğ’™tâˆ’2))âˆ¥23superscript1ğ‘2superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘–ğ‘˜1ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğœğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡2superscriptsubscriptğœğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡âˆ‡ğ‘“superscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘–ğ‘˜1ğ‘¡âˆ‡ğ‘“superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡22\displaystyle+3(1-a)^{2}\left\lVert(\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t};\zeta_{i,k}^{t})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x}^{t-2};\zeta_{i,k}^{t}))-(\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})-\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-2}))\right\rVert^{2}
+3â€‹a2â€‹âˆ¥1Sâ€‹âˆ‘jâˆˆğ’®tâˆ‡fjâ€‹(ğ’™tâˆ’2)âˆ’âˆ‡fâ€‹(ğ’™tâˆ’2)âˆ¥23superscriptğ‘2superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥1ğ‘†subscriptğ‘—superscriptğ’®ğ‘¡âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘—superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡2âˆ‡ğ‘“superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡22\displaystyle+3a^{2}\left\lVert\frac{1}{S}\sum_{j\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}\nabla f_{j}(\bm{x}^{t-2})-\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-2})\right\rVert^{2}
â‰¤3ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ’1âˆ¥2+3Î´2âˆ¥ğ’ši,kâˆ’1tâˆ’ğ’™tâˆ’2âˆ¥2+3â€‹a2â€‹G2S.\displaystyle\leq 3\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+3\delta^{2}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-2}\rVert^{2}+\frac{3a^{2}G^{2}}{S}\,.

The last inequality used the Hessian similarity LemmaÂ 3 to bound the second term and the heterogeneity bound ((A1)) to bound the last term. Also, (1âˆ’a)2â‰¤1superscript1ğ‘21(1-a)^{2}\leq 1 since aâˆˆ[0,1]ğ‘01a\in[0,1]. âˆ

Distance moved in each step.

We show that the distance moved by a client in each step during the client update can be controlled.

Lemma 20.

For MimeMVR updates (13) with Î·â‰¤16â€‹Kâ€‹Î´ğœ‚16ğ¾ğ›¿\eta\leq\frac{1}{6K\delta} and given ((A1)) and ((A2)), the following holds

Î”i,ktâ‰¤(1+1K)Î”i,kâˆ’1t+18Î·2Ka2G2S+18Î·2Kğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ’1âˆ¥2+6Î·2Kâˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)âˆ¥2,\Delta_{i,k}^{t}\leq\left(1+\frac{1}{K}\right)\Delta_{i,k-1}^{t}+18\eta^{2}Ka^{2}\frac{G^{2}}{S}+18\eta^{2}K\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+6\eta^{2}K\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}\,,

where we define Î”i,kt:=ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ²i,ktâˆ’ğ±tâˆ’2âˆ¥2\Delta_{i,k}^{t}:=\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-2}\rVert^{2}.

Proof.

Starting from the MimeMVR update (13) and the relaxed triangle inequality with c=2â€‹Kğ‘2ğ¾c=2K,

ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’ši,ktâˆ’ğ’™tâˆ’2âˆ¥2\displaystyle\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-2}\rVert^{2} =ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’ši,kâˆ’1tâˆ’Î·ğ’…i,ktâˆ’ğ’™tâˆ’2âˆ¥2\displaystyle=\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t}-\eta\bm{d}_{i,k}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-2}\rVert^{2}
â‰¤(1+12â€‹K)ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’ši,kâˆ’1tâˆ’ğ’™tâˆ’2âˆ¥2+(2K+1)Î·2ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’…i,ktâˆ¥2\displaystyle\leq\left(1+\frac{1}{2K}\right)\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-2}\rVert^{2}+(2K+1)\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{d}_{i,k}^{t}\rVert^{2}
â‰¤(1+12â€‹K)ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’ši,kâˆ’1tâˆ’ğ’™tâˆ’2âˆ¥2+6KÎ·2ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’…i,ktâˆ’âˆ‡f(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)âˆ¥2\displaystyle\leq\left(1+\frac{1}{2K}\right)\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-2}\rVert^{2}+6K\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{d}_{i,k}^{t}-\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}
+6KÎ·2ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)âˆ¥2\displaystyle\hskip 56.9055pt+6K\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}
â‰¤(1+12â€‹K+18KÎ·2Î´2)ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’ši,kâˆ’1tâˆ’ğ’™tâˆ’2âˆ¥2\displaystyle\leq\left(1+\frac{1}{2K}+18K\eta^{2}\delta^{2}\right)\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-2}\rVert^{2}
+18KÎ·2ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ’1âˆ¥2+18â€‹Kâ€‹Î·2â€‹a2â€‹G2S+6KÎ·2ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)âˆ¥2.\displaystyle\hskip 56.9055pt+18K\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{18K\eta^{2}a^{2}G^{2}}{S}+6K\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}\,.

The last inequality used the update variance bound LemmaÂ 19. We can simplify the expression further since Î·â‰¤16â€‹Kâ€‹Î´ğœ‚16ğ¾ğ›¿\eta\leq\frac{1}{6K\delta} implies 18â€‹Kâ€‹Î·2â€‹Î´2â‰¤12â€‹K18ğ¾superscriptğœ‚2superscriptğ›¿212ğ¾18K\eta^{2}\delta^{2}\leq\frac{1}{2K}. âˆ

Progress in one step.

Now we can compute the progress made in each step.

Lemma 21.

For any client update step with step size Î·â‰¤minâ¡(1L,1192â€‹Î´â€‹K)ğœ‚1ğ¿1192ğ›¿ğ¾\eta\leq\min\left(\frac{1}{L},\frac{1}{192\delta K}\right) and given that ((A1)), ((A2)) hold, we have

ğ”¼â¡fâ€‹(ğ’ši,kt)+Î´â€‹(1+2K)Kâˆ’kâ€‹Î”i,ktğ”¼ğ‘“superscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡ğ›¿superscript12ğ¾ğ¾ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptÎ”ğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡\displaystyle\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{y}_{i,k}^{t})+\delta\left(1+\frac{2}{K}\right)^{K-k}\Delta_{i,k}^{t} â‰¤ğ”¼â¡fâ€‹(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)+Î´â€‹(1+2K)Kâˆ’(kâˆ’1)â€‹Î”i,kâˆ’1tabsentğ”¼ğ‘“superscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘–ğ‘˜1ğ‘¡ğ›¿superscript12ğ¾ğ¾ğ‘˜1superscriptsubscriptÎ”ğ‘–ğ‘˜1ğ‘¡\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})+\delta\left(1+\frac{2}{K}\right)^{K-(k-1)}\Delta_{i,k-1}^{t}
âˆ’Î·4ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)âˆ¥2+3Î·ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ’1âˆ¥2+3â€‹Î·â€‹a2â€‹G2S.\displaystyle\hskip 56.9055pt-\frac{\eta}{4}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}+3\eta\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{3\eta a^{2}G^{2}}{S}\,.
Proof.

The assumption that fğ‘“f is Lğ¿L-smooth implies a quadratic upper bound (10).

fâ€‹(ğ’ši,kt)âˆ’fâ€‹(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)ğ‘“superscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡ğ‘“superscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘–ğ‘˜1ğ‘¡\displaystyle f(\bm{y}_{i,k}^{t})-f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t}) â‰¤âˆ’Î·â€‹âŸ¨âˆ‡fâ€‹(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t),ğ’…i,ktâŸ©+Lâ€‹Î·22â€‹âˆ¥ğ’…i,ktâˆ¥2absentğœ‚âˆ‡ğ‘“superscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘–ğ‘˜1ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ’…ğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡ğ¿superscriptğœ‚22superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptsubscriptğ’…ğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡2\displaystyle\leq-\eta\langle\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t}),\bm{d}_{i,k}^{t}\rangle+\frac{L\eta^{2}}{2}\lVert\bm{d}_{i,k}^{t}\rVert^{2}
=âˆ’Î·2â€‹âˆ¥âˆ‡fâ€‹(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)âˆ¥2+Lâ€‹Î·2âˆ’Î·2â€‹âˆ¥ğ’…i,ktâˆ¥2+Î·2â€‹âˆ¥ğ’…i,ktâˆ’âˆ‡fâ€‹(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)âˆ¥2.absentğœ‚2superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥âˆ‡ğ‘“superscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘–ğ‘˜1ğ‘¡2ğ¿superscriptğœ‚2ğœ‚2superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptsubscriptğ’…ğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡2ğœ‚2superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptsubscriptğ’…ğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡âˆ‡ğ‘“superscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘–ğ‘˜1ğ‘¡2\displaystyle=-\frac{\eta}{2}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}+\frac{L\eta^{2}-\eta}{2}\lVert\bm{d}_{i,k}^{t}\rVert^{2}+\frac{\eta}{2}\lVert\bm{d}_{i,k}^{t}-\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}\,.

The second equality used the fact that for any a,bğ‘ğ‘a,b, âˆ’2â€‹aâ€‹b=(aâˆ’b)2âˆ’a2âˆ’b22ğ‘ğ‘superscriptğ‘ğ‘2superscriptğ‘2superscriptğ‘2-2ab=(a-b)^{2}-a^{2}-b^{2}. The second term can be removed since Î·â‰¤1Lğœ‚1ğ¿\eta\leq\frac{1}{L}. Taking expectation on both sides and using the update variance bound LemmaÂ 19,

ğ”¼â¡fâ€‹(ğ’ši,kt)âˆ’ğ”¼â¡fâ€‹(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)ğ”¼ğ‘“superscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡ğ”¼ğ‘“superscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘–ğ‘˜1ğ‘¡\displaystyle\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}f(\bm{y}_{i,k}^{t})-\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t}) â‰¤âˆ’Î·2ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)âˆ¥2+3â€‹Î·â€‹a2â€‹G22â€‹S\displaystyle\leq-\frac{\eta}{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}+\frac{3\eta a^{2}G^{2}}{2S}
+3â€‹Î·2ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ’1âˆ¥2+3â€‹Î·â€‹Î´22Î”i,kâˆ’1t\displaystyle\hskip 56.9055pt+\frac{3\eta}{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{3\eta\delta^{2}}{2}\Delta^{t}_{i,k-1}
â‰¤âˆ’Î·2ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)âˆ¥2+3â€‹Î·â€‹a2â€‹G22â€‹S\displaystyle\leq-\frac{\eta}{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}+\frac{3\eta a^{2}G^{2}}{2S}
+3â€‹Î·2ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ’1âˆ¥2+3â€‹Î·â€‹Î´22Î”i,kâˆ’1t\displaystyle\hskip 56.9055pt+\frac{3\eta}{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{3\eta\delta^{2}}{2}\Delta^{t}_{i,k-1}

Multiplying the distance bound LemmaÂ 20 by Î´â€‹(1+2K)Kâˆ’kğ›¿superscript12ğ¾ğ¾ğ‘˜\delta\left(1+\frac{2}{K}\right)^{K-k}. Note that for any Kâ‰¥1ğ¾1K\geq 1 and kâˆˆ[K]ğ‘˜delimited-[]ğ¾k\in[K], we have 1â‰¤(1+2K)Kâˆ’kâ‰¤81superscript12ğ¾ğ¾ğ‘˜81\leq\left(1+\frac{2}{K}\right)^{K-k}\leq 8. Then we get

Î´â€‹(1+2K)Kâˆ’kâ€‹Î”i,ktğ›¿superscript12ğ¾ğ¾ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptÎ”ğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡\displaystyle\delta\left(1+\frac{2}{K}\right)^{K-k}\Delta_{i,k}^{t} â‰¤Î´(1+2K)Kâˆ’k((1+1K)Î”i,kâˆ’1t+18Î·2Ka2G2S\displaystyle\leq\delta\left(1+\frac{2}{K}\right)^{K-k}\Bigg{(}\Big{(}1+\frac{1}{K}\Big{)}\Delta_{i,k-1}^{t}+18\eta^{2}Ka^{2}\frac{G^{2}}{S}
+18Î·2Kğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ’1âˆ¥2+6Î·2Kâˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)âˆ¥2)\displaystyle\hskip 85.35826pt+18\eta^{2}K\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+6\eta^{2}K\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}\Bigg{)}
