â‰¤Î´â€‹(1+2K)Kâˆ’(kâˆ’1)â€‹Î”i,kâˆ’1tâˆ’Î´Kâ€‹(1+2K)Kâˆ’kâ€‹Î”i,kâˆ’1tabsentğ›¿superscript12ğ¾ğ¾ğ‘˜1superscriptsubscriptÎ”ğ‘–ğ‘˜1ğ‘¡ğ›¿ğ¾superscript12ğ¾ğ¾ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptÎ”ğ‘–ğ‘˜1ğ‘¡\displaystyle\leq\delta\left(1+\frac{2}{K}\right)^{K-(k-1)}\Delta_{i,k-1}^{t}-\frac{\delta}{K}\left(1+\frac{2}{K}\right)^{K-k}\Delta_{i,k-1}^{t}
+48Î·2Î´Kğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)âˆ¥2+144â€‹Î·2â€‹Î´â€‹Kâ€‹a2â€‹G2S+144Î·2Î´Kğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ’1âˆ¥2\displaystyle\hskip 28.45274pt+48\eta^{2}\delta K\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}+\frac{144\eta^{2}\delta Ka^{2}G^{2}}{S}+144\eta^{2}\delta K\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}
â‰¤Î´(1+2K)Kâˆ’(kâˆ’1)Î”i,kâˆ’1tâˆ’Î´KÎ”i,kâˆ’1t+48Î·2Î´Kğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)âˆ¥2\displaystyle\leq\delta\left(1+\frac{2}{K}\right)^{K-(k-1)}\Delta_{i,k-1}^{t}-\frac{\delta}{K}\Delta_{i,k-1}^{t}+48\eta^{2}\delta K\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}
+144â€‹Î·2â€‹Î´â€‹Kâ€‹a2â€‹G2S+144Î·2Î´Kğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ’1âˆ¥2.\displaystyle\hskip 28.45274pt+\frac{144\eta^{2}\delta Ka^{2}G^{2}}{S}+144\eta^{2}\delta K\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}\,.

Adding these two inequalities together yields

ğ”¼â¡fâ€‹(ğ’ši,kt)+Î´â€‹(1+2K)Kâˆ’kâ€‹Î”i,ktğ”¼ğ‘“superscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡ğ›¿superscript12ğ¾ğ¾ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptÎ”ğ‘–ğ‘˜ğ‘¡\displaystyle\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{y}_{i,k}^{t})+\delta\left(1+\frac{2}{K}\right)^{K-k}\Delta_{i,k}^{t} â‰¤ğ”¼â¡fâ€‹(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)+Î´â€‹(1+2K)Kâˆ’(kâˆ’1)â€‹Î”i,kâˆ’1tabsentğ”¼ğ‘“superscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘–ğ‘˜1ğ‘¡ğ›¿superscript12ğ¾ğ¾ğ‘˜1superscriptsubscriptÎ”ğ‘–ğ‘˜1ğ‘¡\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})+\delta\left(1+\frac{2}{K}\right)^{K-(k-1)}\Delta_{i,k-1}^{t}
âˆ’(Î·2âˆ’48Î·2Î´K)ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)âˆ¥2\displaystyle\hskip 28.45274pt-\left(\frac{\eta}{2}-48\eta^{2}\delta K\right)\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}
+(3â€‹Î·2+144Î·2Î´K)ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ’1âˆ¥2\displaystyle\hskip 28.45274pt+\left(\frac{3\eta}{2}+144\eta^{2}\delta K\right)\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}
+(3â€‹Î·2++144Î·2Î´K)a2â€‹G2S.\displaystyle\hskip 28.45274pt+\left(\frac{3\eta}{2}++144\eta^{2}\delta K\right)\frac{a^{2}G^{2}}{S}\,.

Using our bound on the step-size that Î·â‰¤1192â€‹Î´â€‹Kğœ‚1192ğ›¿ğ¾\eta\leq\frac{1}{192\delta K} implies that Î·â€‹Î´â€‹Kâ‰¤148âˆ—4ğœ‚ğ›¿ğ¾1484\eta\delta K\leq\frac{1}{48*4}. âˆ

G.4 Change in each round

We now see how the quantities we defined change across rounds.

Distance moved in a round.
Lemma 22.

For MimeMVR updates (13) with Î·â‰¤16â€‹Kâ€‹Î´ğœ‚16ğ¾ğ›¿\eta\leq\frac{1}{6K\delta} and given ((A1)) and ((A2)), the following holds

Î”tâ‰¤54K2Î·2ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ’1âˆ¥2+54â€‹K2â€‹Î·2â€‹a2â€‹G2S+1Kâ€‹Sâˆ‘i,k18K2Î·2ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)âˆ¥2,\Delta^{t}\leq 54K^{2}\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{54K^{2}\eta^{2}a^{2}G^{2}}{S}+\frac{1}{KS}\sum_{i,k}18K^{2}\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}\,,

where we define Î”t:=ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ±tâˆ’ğ±tâˆ’1âˆ¥2\Delta^{t}:=\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{x}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}.

Proof.

Starting from the MimeMVR update (13) and following the proof of LemmaÂ 20,

ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’ši,ktâˆ’ğ’™tâˆ’1âˆ¥2\displaystyle\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-1}\rVert^{2} =ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’ši,kâˆ’1tâˆ’Î·ğ’…i,ktâˆ’ğ’™tâˆ’1âˆ¥2\displaystyle=\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t}-\eta\bm{d}_{i,k}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}
â‰¤(1+12â€‹K)ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’ši,kâˆ’1tâˆ’ğ’™tâˆ’1âˆ¥2+(2K+1)Î·2ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’…i,ktâˆ¥2\displaystyle\leq\left(1+\frac{1}{2K}\right)\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+(2K+1)\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{d}_{i,k}^{t}\rVert^{2}
â‰¤(1+12â€‹K)ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’ši,kâˆ’1tâˆ’ğ’™tâˆ’1âˆ¥2+6KÎ·2ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’…i,ktâˆ’âˆ‡f(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)âˆ¥2\displaystyle\leq\left(1+\frac{1}{2K}\right)\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+6K\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{d}_{i,k}^{t}-\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}
+6KÎ·2ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)âˆ¥2\displaystyle\hskip 56.9055pt+6K\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}
â‰¤(1+1K)ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’ši,kâˆ’1tâˆ’ğ’™tâˆ’1âˆ¥2\displaystyle\leq\left(1+\frac{1}{K}\right)\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}
+18KÎ·2ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ’1âˆ¥2+18â€‹Kâ€‹Î·2â€‹a2â€‹G2S+6KÎ·2ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)âˆ¥2.\displaystyle\hskip 56.9055pt+18K\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{18K\eta^{2}a^{2}G^{2}}{S}+6K\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}\,.

Note that ğ’™t=1Sâ€‹âˆ‘iâˆˆğ’®ğ’ši,Ktsuperscriptğ’™ğ‘¡1ğ‘†subscriptğ‘–ğ’®superscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘–ğ¾ğ‘¡\bm{x}^{t}=\frac{1}{S}\sum_{i\in\mathcal{S}}\bm{y}_{i,K}^{t} and so,

ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’™tâˆ’ğ’™tâˆ’1âˆ¥2\displaystyle\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{x}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}
â‰¤1Sâˆ‘iâˆˆğ’®ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’ši,Ktâˆ’ğ’™tâˆ’1âˆ¥2\displaystyle\leq\frac{1}{S}\sum_{i\in\mathcal{S}}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,K}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}
â‰¤1Sâˆ‘iâˆˆğ’®âˆ‘k(18KÎ·2ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ’1âˆ¥2+18â€‹Kâ€‹Î·2â€‹a2â€‹G2S+6KÎ·2ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)âˆ¥2)(1+1K)Kâˆ’k\displaystyle\leq\frac{1}{S}\sum_{i\in\mathcal{S}}\sum_{k}\left(18K\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{18K\eta^{2}a^{2}G^{2}}{S}+6K\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}\right)\left(1+\frac{1}{K}\right)^{K-k}
â‰¤54K2Î·2ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ’1âˆ¥2+54â€‹K2â€‹Î·2â€‹a2â€‹G2S+1Kâ€‹Sâˆ‘i,k18K2Î·2ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)âˆ¥2.\displaystyle\leq 54K^{2}\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{54K^{2}\eta^{2}a^{2}G^{2}}{S}+\frac{1}{KS}\sum_{i,k}18K^{2}\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}\,.

Here we used the inequality that for all kğ‘˜k, (1+1K)Kâˆ’kâ‰¤3superscript11ğ¾ğ¾ğ‘˜3\left(1+\frac{1}{K}\right)^{K-k}\leq 3. âˆ

Server momentum variance.

We compute the error of the server momentum ğ’tâˆ’1superscriptğ’ğ‘¡1\bm{m}^{t-1} defined as ğ’†t=ğ’tâˆ’âˆ‡fâ€‹(ğ’™tâˆ’1)superscriptğ’†ğ‘¡superscriptğ’ğ‘¡âˆ‡ğ‘“superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡1\bm{e}^{t}=\bm{m}^{t}-\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1}). Its expected norm can be bounded as follows.

Lemma 23.

For the momentum update (16), given ((A1)) and ((A2)), the following holds for any Î·â‰¤151â€‹Î´â€‹Kğœ‚151ğ›¿ğ¾\eta\leq\frac{1}{51\delta K} and 1â‰¥aâ‰¥2592â€‹K2â€‹Î´2â€‹Î·21ğ‘2592superscriptğ¾2superscriptğ›¿2superscriptğœ‚21\geq a\geq 2592K^{2}\delta^{2}\eta^{2},

ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ¥2â‰¤(1âˆ’23â€‹a24)ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ’1âˆ¥2+3â€‹a2â€‹G2S+1Kâ€‹Sâˆ‘i,k36K2Î´2Î·2ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)âˆ¥2.\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}\leq(1-\tfrac{23a}{24})\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{3a^{2}G^{2}}{S}+\frac{1}{KS}\sum_{i,k}36K^{2}\delta^{2}\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}\,.
Proof.

Starting from the momentum update (16),

ğ’†tsuperscriptğ’†ğ‘¡\displaystyle\bm{e}^{t} =(1âˆ’a)â€‹ğ’†tâˆ’1absent1ğ‘superscriptğ’†ğ‘¡1\displaystyle=(1-a)\bm{e}^{t-1}
+(1âˆ’a)â€‹(1Sâ€‹âˆ‘jâˆˆğ’®t(âˆ‡fjâ€‹(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ’âˆ‡fjâ€‹(ğ’™tâˆ’2))âˆ’âˆ‡fâ€‹(ğ’™tâˆ’1)+âˆ‡fâ€‹(ğ’™tâˆ’2))1ğ‘1ğ‘†subscriptğ‘—superscriptğ’®ğ‘¡âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘—superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡1âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘—superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡2âˆ‡ğ‘“superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡1âˆ‡ğ‘“superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡2\displaystyle\hskip 14.22636pt+(1-a)\left(\frac{1}{S}\sum_{j\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}(\nabla f_{j}(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\nabla f_{j}(\bm{x}^{t-2}))-\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})+\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-2})\right)
+a(1Sâˆ‘jâˆˆğ’®t(âˆ‡fj(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ’âˆ‡f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)).\displaystyle\hskip 14.22636pt+a\left(\frac{1}{S}\sum_{j\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}(\nabla f_{j}(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\right)\,.

Now, the term ğ’†tâˆ’1superscriptğ’†ğ‘¡1\bm{e}^{t-1} does not have any information from round tğ‘¡t and hence is statistically independent of the rest of the terms. Further, the rest of the terms have mean 0. Hence, we can separate out the zero mean noise terms from the ğ’†tâˆ’1superscriptğ’†ğ‘¡1\bm{e}^{t-1} following LemmaÂ 2 and then the relaxed triangle inequality LemmaÂ 1 to claim

ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ¥2\displaystyle\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2} â‰¤(1âˆ’a)2ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ’1âˆ¥2\displaystyle\leq(1-a)^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}
+2â€‹(1âˆ’a)2â€‹âˆ¥1Sâ€‹âˆ‘jâˆˆğ’®t(âˆ‡fjâ€‹(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ’âˆ‡fjâ€‹(ğ’™tâˆ’2))âˆ’âˆ‡fâ€‹(ğ’™tâˆ’1)+âˆ‡fâ€‹(ğ’™tâˆ’2)âˆ¥22superscript1ğ‘2superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥1ğ‘†subscriptğ‘—superscriptğ’®ğ‘¡âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘—superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡1âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘—superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡2âˆ‡ğ‘“superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡1âˆ‡ğ‘“superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡22\displaystyle\hskip 14.22636pt+2(1-a)^{2}\left\lVert\frac{1}{S}\sum_{j\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}(\nabla f_{j}(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\nabla f_{j}(\bm{x}^{t-2}))-\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})+\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-2})\right\rVert^{2}
+2a2âˆ¥1Sâˆ‘jâˆˆğ’®t(âˆ‡fj(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ’âˆ‡f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)âˆ¥2\displaystyle\hskip 14.22636pt+2a^{2}\left\lVert\frac{1}{S}\sum_{j\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}(\nabla f_{j}(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\right\rVert^{2}
â‰¤(1âˆ’a)2ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ’1âˆ¥2+2(1âˆ’a)2Î´2âˆ¥ğ’™tâˆ’1âˆ’ğ’™tâˆ’2âˆ¥2+2â€‹a2â€‹G2S.\displaystyle\leq(1-a)^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+2(1-a)^{2}\delta^{2}\lVert\bm{x}^{t-1}-\bm{x}^{t-2}\rVert^{2}+\frac{2a^{2}G^{2}}{S}\,.

The inequality used the Hessian similarity LemmaÂ 3 to bound the second term and the heterogeneity bound ((A1)) to bound the last term. Finally, note that (1âˆ’a)2â‰¤(1âˆ’a)â‰¤1superscript1ğ‘21ğ‘1(1-a)^{2}\leq(1-a)\leq 1 for aâˆˆ[0,1]ğ‘01a\in[0,1]. We can continue by bounding Î”tâˆ’1superscriptÎ”ğ‘¡1\Delta^{t-1} using LemmaÂ 22.

ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ¥2\displaystyle\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2} â‰¤(1âˆ’a)ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ’1âˆ¥2+2Î´2Î”tâˆ’1+2â€‹a2â€‹G2S\displaystyle\leq(1-a)\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+2\delta^{2}\Delta^{t-1}+\frac{2a^{2}G^{2}}{S}
â‰¤(1âˆ’a)ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ’1âˆ¥2+2â€‹a2â€‹G2S\displaystyle\leq(1-a)\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{2a^{2}G^{2}}{S}
+108K2Î´2Î·2ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ’1âˆ¥2+108â€‹K2â€‹Î´2â€‹Î·2â€‹a2â€‹G2S+1Kâ€‹Sâˆ‘i,k36K2Î´2Î·2ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)âˆ¥2\displaystyle\hskip 14.22636pt+108K^{2}\delta^{2}\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{108K^{2}\delta^{2}\eta^{2}a^{2}G^{2}}{S}+\frac{1}{KS}\sum_{i,k}36K^{2}\delta^{2}\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}
â‰¤(1âˆ’23â€‹a24)ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ’1âˆ¥2+3â€‹a2â€‹G2S+1Kâ€‹Sâˆ‘i,k36K2Î´2Î·2ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)âˆ¥2.\displaystyle\leq(1-\tfrac{23a}{24})\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{3a^{2}G^{2}}{S}+\frac{1}{KS}\sum_{i,k}36K^{2}\delta^{2}\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}\,.

The last step used our bound on the momentum parameter that 1â‰¥aâ‰¥2592â€‹Î·2â€‹Î´2â€‹K21ğ‘2592superscriptğœ‚2superscriptğ›¿2superscriptğ¾21\geq a\geq 2592\eta^{2}\delta^{2}K^{2}. Note that Î·â‰¤151â€‹Î´â€‹Kğœ‚151ğ›¿ğ¾\eta\leq\frac{1}{51\delta K} ensures that this set is non-empty. âˆ

Progress in one round.

Finally, we can compute the progress made in a round. Note that we need a technical condition that fğ‘“f is Î´ğ›¿\delta-weakly convex. However, this is only needed because we insist on running the algorithm on Sğ‘†S clients in parallel and then averaging their weightsâ€”the averaging requires weak convexity to ensure that the loss doesnâ€™t blow up. It has been experimentally observed in [41] that with the right initialization, averaging of the parameters does not increase the loss value and so weak convexity within this region might be vaalid. Finally note that if we instead simply run the local updates on a single chosen client with all the rest only being used to compute ğ’„tâˆ’1superscriptğ’„ğ‘¡1\bm{c}^{t-1}, we will retain all convergence rates without needing weak-convexity.

Lemma 24.

For any round of MimeMVR with step size Î·â‰¤minâ¡(1L,1864â€‹Î´â€‹K)ğœ‚1ğ¿1864ğ›¿ğ¾\eta\leq\min\left(\frac{1}{L},\frac{1}{864\delta K}\right) and momentum parameter aâ‰¥912â€‹Î·2â€‹Î´2â€‹K2ğ‘912superscriptğœ‚2superscriptğ›¿2superscriptğ¾2a\geq 912\eta^{2}\delta^{2}K^{2}. Then, given that ((A1))â€“((A2)) hold and fğ‘“f is Î´ğ›¿\delta-weakly convex, we have

Î·24â€‹Kâ€‹Sâˆ‘kâˆˆ[K],jâˆˆğ’®tğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)âˆ¥2â‰¤Î¦tâˆ’1âˆ’Î¦t+17â€‹Î·â€‹aâ€‹Î´2â€‹K2â€‹G2S,\displaystyle\frac{\eta}{24KS}\sum_{k\in[K],j\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}\leq\Phi^{t-1}-\Phi^{t}+\frac{17\eta a\delta^{2}K^{2}G^{2}}{S}\,,

where we define the sequence

Î¦t:=1Kğ”¼[f(ğ’™t)âˆ’fâ‹†]+96â€‹Î·23â€‹ağ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ¥2+8â€‹Î´KÎ”t.\Phi^{t}:=\tfrac{1}{K}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[f(\bm{x}^{t})-f^{\star}]+\frac{96\eta}{23a}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}+\frac{8\delta}{K}\Delta^{t}\,.
Proof.

We start by summing over the progress in single client updates as in LemmaÂ 21

âˆ‘kâˆˆ[K]Î·4ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’ši,0t)âˆ¥2\displaystyle\sum_{k\in[K]}\frac{\eta}{4}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,0}^{t})\rVert^{2} â‰¤ğ”¼â¡fâ€‹(ğ’ši,0t)+Î´â€‹(1+2K)Kâ€‹Î”i,0tabsentğ”¼ğ‘“superscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘–0ğ‘¡ğ›¿superscript12ğ¾ğ¾superscriptsubscriptÎ”ğ‘–0ğ‘¡\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{y}_{i,0}^{t})+\delta\left(1+\frac{2}{K}\right)^{K}\Delta_{i,0}^{t}
âˆ’ğ”¼â¡fâ€‹(ğ’ši,Kt)âˆ’Î´â€‹Î”i,Ktğ”¼ğ‘“superscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘–ğ¾ğ‘¡ğ›¿superscriptsubscriptÎ”ğ‘–ğ¾ğ‘¡\displaystyle\hskip 28.45274pt-\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{y}_{i,K}^{t})-\delta\Delta_{i,K}^{t}
+3Î·Kğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ’1âˆ¥2+3â€‹Î·â€‹Kâ€‹a2â€‹G2S\displaystyle\hskip 28.45274pt+3\eta K\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{3\eta Ka^{2}G^{2}}{S}
â‰¤ğ”¼â¡fâ€‹(ğ’ši,0t)+8â€‹Î´â€‹Î”i,0tâˆ’ğ”¼â¡fâ€‹(ğ’ši,Kt)âˆ’Î´â€‹Î”i,Ktabsentğ”¼ğ‘“superscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘–0ğ‘¡8ğ›¿superscriptsubscriptÎ”ğ‘–0ğ‘¡ğ”¼ğ‘“superscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘–ğ¾ğ‘¡ğ›¿superscriptsubscriptÎ”ğ‘–ğ¾ğ‘¡\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{y}_{i,0}^{t})+8\delta\Delta_{i,0}^{t}-\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{y}_{i,K}^{t})-\delta\Delta_{i,K}^{t}
+3Î·Kğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ’1âˆ¥2+3â€‹Î·â€‹Kâ€‹a2â€‹G2S\displaystyle\hskip 28.45274pt+3\eta K\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{3\eta Ka^{2}G^{2}}{S}
â‰¤ğ”¼â¡fâ€‹(ğ’™tâˆ’1)+8â€‹Î´â€‹Î”tâˆ’1âˆ’ğ”¼â¡fâ€‹(ğ’ši,Kt)âˆ’Î´â€‹Î”i,Ktabsentğ”¼ğ‘“superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡18ğ›¿superscriptÎ”ğ‘¡1ğ”¼ğ‘“superscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘–ğ¾ğ‘¡ğ›¿superscriptsubscriptÎ”ğ‘–ğ¾ğ‘¡\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})+8\delta\Delta^{t-1}-\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{y}_{i,K}^{t})-\delta\Delta_{i,K}^{t}
+3Î·Kğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ’1âˆ¥2+3â€‹Î·â€‹Kâ€‹a2â€‹G2S.\displaystyle\hskip 28.45274pt+3\eta K\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{3\eta Ka^{2}G^{2}}{S}\,.

Recall that Î”i,kt=ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’ši,ktâˆ’ğ’™tâˆ’2âˆ¥2\Delta_{i,k}^{t}=\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-2}\rVert^{2} and ğ’ši,0t=ğ’™tâˆ’1subscriptsuperscriptğ’šğ‘¡ğ‘–0superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡1\bm{y}^{t}_{i,0}=\bm{x}^{t-1}. This gives the last step above, making Î”i,0t=Î”tâˆ’1superscriptsubscriptÎ”ğ‘–0ğ‘¡superscriptÎ”ğ‘¡1\Delta_{i,0}^{t}=\Delta^{t-1}. Then by the averaging LemmaÂ 4, we have

1Sâ€‹âˆ‘jâˆˆğ’®tğ”¼â¡[fâ€‹(ğ’šj,Kt)]+Î´â€‹Î”j,Kt1ğ‘†subscriptğ‘—superscriptğ’®ğ‘¡ğ”¼ğ‘“superscriptsubscriptğ’šğ‘—ğ¾ğ‘¡ğ›¿superscriptsubscriptÎ”ğ‘—ğ¾ğ‘¡\displaystyle\frac{1}{S}\sum_{j\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[f(\bm{y}_{j,K}^{t})]+\delta\Delta_{j,K}^{t} =1Sâˆ‘jâˆˆğ’®ğ”¼[f(ğ’šj,Kt)]+Î´ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’™tâˆ’2âˆ’ğ’šj,Ktâˆ¥2\displaystyle=\frac{1}{S}\sum_{j\in\mathcal{S}}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[f(\bm{y}_{j,K}^{t})]+\delta\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{x}^{t-2}-\bm{y}_{j,K}^{t}\rVert^{2}
â‰¥ğ”¼[f(ğ’™t)]+Î´ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’™tâˆ’2âˆ’ğ’™tâˆ¥2.\displaystyle\geq\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[f(\bm{x}^{t})]+\delta\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{x}^{t-2}-\bm{x}^{t}\rVert^{2}\,.

So by averaging our inequality over the sampled clients, and diving our summation over the updates by Kğ¾K, we get

Î·4â€‹Kâ€‹Sâˆ‘kâˆˆ[K],jâˆˆğ’®tğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)âˆ¥2\displaystyle\frac{\eta}{4KS}\sum_{k\in[K],j\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}
â‰¤1Kğ”¼[f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)]+3Î·ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ’1âˆ¥2+8â€‹Î´KÎ”tâˆ’1âˆ’1Kğ”¼[f(ğ’™t)]+3â€‹Î·â€‹a2â€‹G2S.\displaystyle\leq\tfrac{1}{K}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[f(\bm{x}^{t-1})]+3\eta\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{8\delta}{K}\Delta^{t-1}-\tfrac{1}{K}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[f(\bm{x}^{t})]+\frac{3\eta a^{2}G^{2}}{S}\,.

We can use the bound on Î”tsubscriptÎ”ğ‘¡\Delta_{t} from LemmaÂ 22 to proceed as

Î·4â€‹Kâ€‹Sâ€‹âˆ‘kâˆˆ[K],jâˆˆğ’®tğœ‚4ğ¾ğ‘†subscriptformulae-sequenceğ‘˜delimited-[]ğ¾ğ‘—superscriptğ’®ğ‘¡\displaystyle\frac{\eta}{4KS}\sum_{k\in[K],j\in\mathcal{S}^{t}} ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)âˆ¥2\displaystyle\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}
â‰¤1Kğ”¼[f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)]âˆ’1Kğ”¼[f(ğ’™t)]+3Î·ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ’1âˆ¥2+3â€‹Î·â€‹a2â€‹G2S\displaystyle\leq\tfrac{1}{K}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[f(\bm{x}^{t-1})]-\tfrac{1}{K}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[f(\bm{x}^{t})]+3\eta\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{3\eta a^{2}G^{2}}{S}
+8â€‹Î´Kâ€‹Î”tâˆ’1âˆ’8â€‹Î´Kâ€‹Î”t8ğ›¿ğ¾superscriptÎ”ğ‘¡18ğ›¿ğ¾superscriptÎ”ğ‘¡\displaystyle\hskip 14.22636pt+\frac{8\delta}{K}\Delta^{t-1}-\frac{8\delta}{K}\Delta^{t}
+432KÎ´Î·2ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ’1âˆ¥2+432â€‹Kâ€‹Î´â€‹Î·2â€‹a2â€‹G2S+1Kâ€‹Sâˆ‘i,k144KÎ´Î·2ğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)âˆ¥2\displaystyle\hskip 14.22636pt+432K\delta\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{432K\delta\eta^{2}a^{2}G^{2}}{S}+\frac{1}{KS}\sum_{i,k}144K\delta\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}
â‰¤1Kğ”¼[f(ğ’™tâˆ’1)]âˆ’1Kğ”¼[f(ğ’™t)]+4Î·ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ’1âˆ¥2+4â€‹Î·â€‹a2â€‹G2S\displaystyle\leq\tfrac{1}{K}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[f(\bm{x}^{t-1})]-\tfrac{1}{K}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[f(\bm{x}^{t})]+4\eta\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{4\eta a^{2}G^{2}}{S}
+8â€‹Î´KÎ”tâˆ’1âˆ’8â€‹Î´KÎ”t+Î·6â€‹Kâ€‹Sâˆ‘i,kğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)âˆ¥2\displaystyle\hskip 14.22636pt+\frac{8\delta}{K}\Delta^{t-1}-\frac{8\delta}{K}\Delta^{t}+\frac{\eta}{6KS}\sum_{i,k}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}

The last step used the bound on the step size that Î·â‰¤1864â€‹Î´â€‹Kğœ‚1864ğ›¿ğ¾\eta\leq\frac{1}{864\delta K}. Now, multiplying the error bound LemmaÂ 23 by 96â€‹Î·23â€‹a96ğœ‚23ğ‘\frac{96\eta}{23a} gives

96â€‹Î·23â€‹ağ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ¥2â‰¤4âˆ—24â€‹Î·23â€‹a(1âˆ’23â€‹a24)ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ’1âˆ¥2+13â€‹Î·â€‹aâ€‹G2S+1Kâ€‹Sâˆ‘i,k38â€‹K2â€‹Î´2â€‹Î·3ağ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)âˆ¥2.\frac{96\eta}{23a}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}\leq\frac{4*24\eta}{23a}(1-\tfrac{23a}{24})\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{13\eta aG^{2}}{S}+\frac{1}{KS}\sum_{i,k}\frac{38K^{2}\delta^{2}\eta^{3}}{a}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}\,.

Adding this to the previously obtained bound yields

Î·4â€‹Kâ€‹Sâˆ‘kâˆˆ[K],jâˆˆğ’®tğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)âˆ¥2\displaystyle\frac{\eta}{4KS}\sum_{k\in[K],j\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2} â‰¤(16+38â€‹K2â€‹Î´2â€‹Î·2a)Î·Kâ€‹Sâˆ‘kâˆˆ[K],jâˆˆğ’®tğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)âˆ¥2\displaystyle\leq\left(\frac{1}{6}+\frac{38K^{2}\delta^{2}\eta^{2}}{a}\right)\frac{\eta}{KS}\sum_{k\in[K],j\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}
+1Kâ€‹ğ”¼â¡[fâ€‹(ğ’™tâˆ’1)]âˆ’1Kâ€‹ğ”¼â¡[fâ€‹(ğ’™t)]1ğ¾ğ”¼ğ‘“superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡11ğ¾ğ”¼ğ‘“superscriptğ’™ğ‘¡\displaystyle\hskip 28.45274pt+\tfrac{1}{K}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[f(\bm{x}^{t-1})]-\tfrac{1}{K}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[f(\bm{x}^{t})]
+96â€‹Î·23â€‹ağ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ’1âˆ¥2âˆ’96â€‹Î·23â€‹ağ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ¥2\displaystyle\hskip 28.45274pt+\frac{96\eta}{23a}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}-\frac{96\eta}{23a}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}
+8â€‹Î´Kâ€‹Î”tâˆ’1âˆ’8â€‹Î´Kâ€‹Î”t8ğ›¿ğ¾superscriptÎ”ğ‘¡18ğ›¿ğ¾superscriptÎ”ğ‘¡\displaystyle\hskip 28.45274pt+\frac{8\delta}{K}\Delta^{t-1}-\frac{8\delta}{K}\Delta^{t}
âˆ’1Kğ”¼[f(ğ’™t)]âˆ’4â€‹Î·ağ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ¥2\displaystyle\hskip 28.45274pt-\tfrac{1}{K}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[f(\bm{x}^{t})]-\frac{4\eta}{a}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}
+(13â€‹Î·â€‹a+3â€‹Î·â€‹a2)â€‹G2S.13ğœ‚ğ‘3ğœ‚superscriptğ‘2superscriptğº2ğ‘†\displaystyle\hskip 28.45274pt+\left(13\eta a+3\eta a^{2}\right)\frac{G^{2}}{S}\,.

Since aâ‰¥912â€‹Î·2â€‹K2â€‹Î´2ğ‘912superscriptğœ‚2superscriptğ¾2superscriptğ›¿2a\geq 912\eta^{2}K^{2}\delta^{2}, we have 14âˆ’(16âˆ’38â€‹K2â€‹Î´2â€‹Î·2a)â‰¥124141638superscriptğ¾2superscriptğ›¿2superscriptğœ‚2ğ‘124\frac{1}{4}-\left(\frac{1}{6}-\frac{38K^{2}\delta^{2}\eta^{2}}{a}\right)\geq\frac{1}{24}. Using this proves the lemma. âˆ

G.5 Final convergence rates

Theorem V (Convergence of MimeMVR).

Let us run MimeMVR with step size Î·=minâ¡(1L,1864â€‹Î´â€‹K,(Sâ€‹(fâ€‹(ğ±0)âˆ’fâ‹†)6936â€‹K3â€‹Tâ€‹Î´2â€‹G2)1/3)ğœ‚1ğ¿1864ğ›¿ğ¾superscriptğ‘†ğ‘“superscriptğ±0superscriptğ‘“â‹†6936superscriptğ¾3ğ‘‡superscriptğ›¿2superscriptğº213\eta=\min\left(\frac{1}{L},\frac{1}{864\delta K},\left(\frac{S(f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star})}{6936K^{3}T\delta^{2}G^{2}}\right)^{1/3}\right) and momentum parameter a=maxâ¡(1536â€‹Î·2â€‹Î´2â€‹K2,1T)ğ‘1536superscriptğœ‚2superscriptğ›¿2superscriptğ¾21ğ‘‡a=\max\left(1536\eta^{2}\delta^{2}K^{2},\frac{1}{T}\right). Then, given that ((A1)) and ((A2)) hold, we have

1Kâ€‹Sâ€‹Tâˆ‘tâˆˆ[T]âˆ‘kâˆˆ[K]âˆ‘jâˆˆğ’®tğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)âˆ¥2â‰¤ğ’ª((Î´2â€‹G2â€‹FSâ€‹T2)1/3+G2Sâ€‹T+(L+Î´â€‹K)â€‹FKâ€‹T),\displaystyle\frac{1}{KST}\sum_{t\in[T]}\sum_{k\in[K]}\sum_{j\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}\leq\mathcal{O}\bigg{(}\Big{(}\frac{\delta^{2}G^{2}F}{ST^{2}}\Big{)}^{1/3}+\frac{G^{2}}{ST}+\frac{(L+\delta K)F}{KT}\Big{)}\,,

where we define F:=fâ€‹(ğ±0)âˆ’fâ‹†assignğ¹ğ‘“superscriptğ±0superscriptğ‘“â‹†F:=f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star}.

Proof.

Unroll the one round progress LemmaÂ 24 and average over Tğ‘‡T rounds to get

1Kâ€‹Sâ€‹Tâˆ‘tâˆˆ[T]âˆ‘kâˆˆ[K]âˆ‘jâˆˆğ’®tğ”¼âˆ¥f(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)âˆ¥2\displaystyle\frac{1}{KST}\sum_{t\in[T]}\sum_{k\in[K]}\sum_{j\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2} â‰¤24â€‹(Î¦0âˆ’Î¦T)Î·â€‹T+408â€‹aâ€‹G2S.absent24superscriptÎ¦0superscriptÎ¦ğ‘‡ğœ‚ğ‘‡408ğ‘superscriptğº2ğ‘†\displaystyle\leq\frac{24(\Phi^{0}-\Phi^{T})}{\eta T}+\frac{408aG^{2}}{S}\,.

Recall that we defined

Î¦t:=1Kğ”¼[f(ğ’™t)âˆ’fâ‹†]+96â€‹Î·23â€‹ağ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†tâˆ¥2+8â€‹Î´KÎ”t.\Phi^{t}:=\tfrac{1}{K}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[f(\bm{x}^{t})-f^{\star}]+\frac{96\eta}{23a}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}+\frac{8\delta}{K}\Delta^{t}\,.

Hence, Î¦Tâ‰¥0superscriptÎ¦ğ‘‡0\Phi^{T}\geq 0. Further, note that by definition Î”0=0superscriptÎ”00\Delta^{0}=0 and ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†0âˆ¥2:=ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’0âˆ’âˆ‡f(ğ’™0)âˆ¥2\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}_{0}\rVert^{2}:=\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{m}^{0}-\nabla f(\bm{x}^{0})\rVert^{2}. [14] show that by using time-varying step sizes, it is possible to directly control the error ğ’†0subscriptğ’†0\bm{e}_{0}. Alternatively, [57] use a large initial accumulation for the momentum term. For the sake of simplicity, we will follow the latter approach. It is straightforward to extend our techniques to the time-varying step-size case as well but with additional proof complexity. Note that either way, the total complexity only changes by a factor of 2. Suppose that we run the algorithm for 2â€‹T2ğ‘‡2T rounds wherein for the first Tğ‘‡T rounds, we simply compute ğ’0=1T0â€‹Sâ€‹âˆ‘t=1T0âˆ‘jâˆˆğ’®tâˆ‡fjâ€‹(ğ’™0).superscriptğ’01subscriptğ‘‡0ğ‘†superscriptsubscriptğ‘¡1subscriptğ‘‡0subscriptğ‘—superscriptğ’®ğ‘¡âˆ‡subscriptğ‘“ğ‘—superscriptğ’™0\bm{m}^{0}=\frac{1}{T_{0}S}\sum_{t=1}^{T_{0}}\sum_{j\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}\nabla f_{j}(\bm{x}^{0})\,. With this, we have ğ’†0=ğ”¼âˆ¥ğ’0âˆ’âˆ‡f(ğ’™0)âˆ¥2â‰¤G2Sâ€‹T.\bm{e}_{0}=\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{m}^{0}-\nabla f(\bm{x}^{0})\rVert^{2}\leq\frac{G^{2}}{ST}\,. Thus, we have for the first round t=1ğ‘¡1t=1

Î¦0=1Kğ”¼[f(ğ’™0)âˆ’fâ‹†]+96â€‹Î·23â€‹ağ”¼âˆ¥ğ’†0âˆ¥2â‰¤1Kğ”¼[f(ğ’™0)âˆ’fâ‹†]+96â€‹Î·â€‹G223â€‹aâ€‹Tâ€‹S.\Phi^{0}=\tfrac{1}{K}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star}]+\frac{96\eta}{23a}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{0}\rVert^{2}\leq\tfrac{1}{K}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star}]+\frac{96\eta G^{2}}{23aTS}\,.

Together, this gives

1Kâ€‹Sâ€‹Tâˆ‘tâˆˆ[T]âˆ‘kâˆˆ[K]âˆ‘iâˆˆğ’®tğ”¼âˆ¥f(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)âˆ¥2\displaystyle\frac{1}{KST}\sum_{t\in[T]}\sum_{k\in[K]}\sum_{i\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2} â‰¤24â€‹(fâ€‹(ğ’™0)âˆ’fâ‹†)Î·â€‹Kâ€‹T+96â€‹G2aâ€‹T2â€‹S+408â€‹aâ€‹G2S.absent24ğ‘“superscriptğ’™0superscriptğ‘“â‹†ğœ‚ğ¾ğ‘‡96superscriptğº2ğ‘superscriptğ‘‡2ğ‘†408ğ‘superscriptğº2ğ‘†\displaystyle\leq\frac{24(f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star})}{\eta KT}+\frac{96G^{2}}{aT^{2}S}+\frac{408aG^{2}}{S}\,.

The above equation holds for any choice of Î·â‰¤minâ¡(1L,1864â€‹Î´â€‹K)ğœ‚1ğ¿1864ğ›¿ğ¾\eta\leq\min\left(\frac{1}{L},\frac{1}{864\delta K}\right) and momentum parameter aâ‰¥912â€‹Î·2â€‹Î´2â€‹K2ğ‘912superscriptğœ‚2superscriptğ›¿2superscriptğ¾2a\geq 912\eta^{2}\delta^{2}K^{2}. Set the momentum parameter as

a=maxâ¡(912â€‹Î·2â€‹Î´2â€‹K2,1T)ğ‘912superscriptğœ‚2superscriptğ›¿2superscriptğ¾21ğ‘‡a=\max\left(912\eta^{2}\delta^{2}K^{2},\frac{1}{T}\right)

With this choice, we can simplify the rate of convergence as

24â€‹(fâ€‹(ğ’™0)âˆ’fâ‹†)Î·â€‹Kâ€‹T+96â€‹G2Tâ€‹S+166464â€‹Î·2â€‹Î´2â€‹K2â€‹G2S+408â€‹G2Sâ€‹T.24ğ‘“superscriptğ’™0superscriptğ‘“â‹†ğœ‚ğ¾ğ‘‡96superscriptğº2ğ‘‡ğ‘†166464superscriptğœ‚2superscriptğ›¿2superscriptğ¾2superscriptğº2ğ‘†408superscriptğº2ğ‘†ğ‘‡\frac{24(f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star})}{\eta KT}+\frac{96G^{2}}{TS}+\frac{166464\eta^{2}\delta^{2}K^{2}G^{2}}{S}+\frac{408G^{2}}{ST}\,.

Now let us pick

Î·=minâ¡(1L,1864â€‹Î´â€‹K,(Sâ€‹(fâ€‹(ğ’™0)âˆ’fâ‹†)6936â€‹K3â€‹Tâ€‹Î´2â€‹G2)1/3).ğœ‚1ğ¿1864ğ›¿ğ¾superscriptğ‘†ğ‘“superscriptğ’™0superscriptğ‘“â‹†6936superscriptğ¾3ğ‘‡superscriptğ›¿2superscriptğº213\eta=\min\left(\frac{1}{L},\frac{1}{864\delta K},\left(\frac{S(f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star})}{6936K^{3}T\delta^{2}G^{2}}\right)^{1/3}\right)\,.

For this combination of step size Î·ğœ‚\eta and ağ‘a, the rate simplifies to

504â€‹G2Tâ€‹S+916â€‹((fâ€‹(ğ’™0)âˆ’fâ‹†)â€‹Î´2â€‹G2Sâ€‹T2)1/3+24â€‹(L+864â€‹Î´â€‹K)â€‹(fâ€‹(ğ’™0)âˆ’fâ‹†)Kâ€‹T.504superscriptğº2ğ‘‡ğ‘†916superscriptğ‘“superscriptğ’™0superscriptğ‘“â‹†superscriptğ›¿2superscriptğº2ğ‘†superscriptğ‘‡21324ğ¿864ğ›¿ğ¾ğ‘“superscriptğ’™0superscriptğ‘“â‹†ğ¾ğ‘‡\frac{504G^{2}}{TS}+916\left(\frac{(f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star})\delta^{2}G^{2}}{ST^{2}}\right)^{1/3}+\frac{24(L+864\delta K)(f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star})}{KT}\,.

This finishes the proof of the theorem. âˆ

Theorem VI (Convergence of MimeLiteMVR).

Let us run MimeLiteMVR with step size Î·=minâ¡(1L,1864â€‹Î´â€‹K,((fâ€‹(ğ±0)âˆ’fâ‹†)6936â€‹K3â€‹Tâ€‹Î´2â€‹(G2+Ïƒ2))1/3)ğœ‚1ğ¿1864ğ›¿ğ¾superscriptğ‘“superscriptğ±0superscriptğ‘“â‹†6936superscriptğ¾3ğ‘‡superscriptğ›¿2superscriptğº2superscriptğœ213\eta=\min\left(\frac{1}{L},\frac{1}{864\delta K},\left(\frac{(f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star})}{6936K^{3}T\delta^{2}(G^{2}+\sigma^{2})}\right)^{1/3}\right) and momentum parameter a=maxâ¡(1536â€‹Î·2â€‹Î´2â€‹K2,1T)ğ‘1536superscriptğœ‚2superscriptğ›¿2superscriptğ¾21ğ‘‡a=\max\left(1536\eta^{2}\delta^{2}K^{2},\frac{1}{T}\right). Then, given that ((A1)) and ((A2*)) hold, we have

1Kâ€‹Sâ€‹Tâˆ‘tâˆˆ[T]âˆ‘kâˆˆ[K]âˆ‘jâˆˆğ’®tğ”¼âˆ¥âˆ‡f(ğ’ši,kâˆ’1t)âˆ¥2â‰¤ğ’ª((Î´2â€‹(G2+Ïƒ2)â€‹FT2)1/3+G2+Ïƒ2T+(L+Î´â€‹K)â€‹FKâ€‹T),\displaystyle\frac{1}{KST}\sum_{t\in[T]}\sum_{k\in[K]}\sum_{j\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}\leq\mathcal{O}\bigg{(}\Big{(}\frac{\delta^{2}(G^{2}+\sigma^{2})F}{T^{2}}\Big{)}^{1/3}+\frac{G^{2}+\sigma^{2}}{T}+\frac{(L+\delta K)F}{KT}\Big{)}\,,

where we define F:=fâ€‹(ğ±0)âˆ’fâ‹†assignğ¹ğ‘“superscriptğ±0superscriptğ‘“â‹†F:=f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star}.

Proof.

The proof for MimeLiteMVR is identical to that of MimeMVR, except that as noted in LemmaÂ 18, the G2Ssuperscriptğº2ğ‘†\frac{G^{2}}{S} term in Mime gets replaced by (G2+Ïƒ2)superscriptğº2superscriptğœ2(G^{2}+\sigma^{2}) everywhere. Note that MimeLiteMVR (LemmaÂ 18) requires a weaker Hessian variance condition of âˆ¥âˆ‡2fiâ€‹(ğ’™)âˆ’âˆ‡2fâ€‹(ğ’™)âˆ¥â‰¤Î´delimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptâˆ‡2subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–ğ’™superscriptâˆ‡2ğ‘“ğ’™ğ›¿\lVert\nabla^{2}f_{i}(\bm{x})-\nabla^{2}f(\bm{x})\rVert\leq\delta as opposed to MimeMVR which needs âˆ¥âˆ‡2fiâ€‹(ğ’™;Î¶)âˆ’âˆ‡2fâ€‹(ğ’™)âˆ¥â‰¤Î´delimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptâˆ‡2subscriptğ‘“ğ‘–ğ’™ğœsuperscriptâˆ‡2ğ‘“ğ’™ğ›¿\lVert\nabla^{2}f_{i}(\bm{x};\zeta)-\nabla^{2}f(\bm{x})\rVert\leq\delta. âˆ
